messages.content: What is the title of the document?
The Constitution of Nepal
What is the first part of the document?
Preliminary
What is the section that discusses citizenship?
Part-2
What is the section that discusses fundamental rights and duties?
Part-3
What is the section that discusses the structure of the state and distribution of state power?
Part-5
What is the first part of the text?
What is the last part of the text?
Other Commissions
How many parts are there in the text?
What is the part that discusses the State Legislative Procedures?
Part- 15
What is the part that discusses the Local Financial Procedures?
Part-19
What are the parts of the Constitution of Nepal?

Provision Relating National Security, Provision relating to Political Parties, Emergency Power, Amendment to the Constitution, Miscellaneous, Transitional Provisions, Definitions and Interpretation, Short Title, Commencement and Repeal
What are the schedules in the Constitution of Nepal?
Schedule- 1, Schedule -2, Schedule -3, Schedule -4, Schedule- 5, Schedule- 6, Schedule- 7, Schedule- 8, Schedule- 9
What is the National Flag of Nepal?
Schedule- 1
What is the National Anthem of Nepal?
Schedule -2
What is the Coat of Arms of Nepal?
Schedule -3
What are the Federal Powers listed in the Constitution of Nepal?
Schedule- 5
What are the State Powers listed in the Constitution of Nepal?
Schedule- 6
What are the Concurrent Powers of Federation and State listed in the Constitution of Nepal?
Schedule- 7
What are the Local level Powers listed in the Constitution of Nepal?
Schedule- 8
What are the Concurrent Power of Federation, State and Local level listed in the Constitution of Nepal?
Schedule- 9
What is the title of the document?
The Constitution of Nepal
When was the Constitution of Nepal published in the Nepal Gazette?
What is the first line of the preamble of the Constitution of Nepal?
We, the Sovereign People of Nepal,
What is the second line of the preamble of the Constitution of Nepal?
Internalizing the people's sovereign right and right to autonomy and self -rule, while maintaining freedom, sovereignty, territorial integrity, national unity, independence and dignity of Nepal,
What is the third line of the preamble of the Constitution of Nepal?

Recalling the glorious history of historic people's movements, armed conflict, dedication and sacrifice undertaken by the Nepalese people at times for the interest of the nation, democracy and progressive changes,
What is the goal of the system in promoting social and cultural solidarity?

Protecting and promoting social and cultural solidarity, tolerance and harmony, and unity in diversity by recognizing the multi-ethnic, multi-lingual, multi-religious, multi-cultural and diverse regional characteristics
What is the objective of building an egalitarian society?
Building an egalitarian society founded on the proportional inclusive and participatory principles in order to ensure economic equality, prosperity and social justice
What is the aim of eliminating discrimination?
Eliminating discrimination based on class, caste, region, language, religion and gender and all forms of caste-based untouchability
What is the commitment of the system to socialism?

Being committed to socialism based on democratic norms and values including the people's competitive multiparty democratic system of governance, civil liberties, fundamental rights, human rights, adult franchise, periodic elections, full freedom of the press, and independent, impartial and competent judiciary
What is the concept of the rule in the system?
The concept of the rule of law
What is mentioned as a part of the press?
the press
What is mentioned as a part of an independent, impartial and competent judiciary?
independent, impartial and competent judiciary
What is mentioned as a concept?
the concept of the rule of law
What is the goal of building a prosperous nation?
to build a prosperous nation
What is passed and promulgated through the Constituent Assembly?
This Constitution
What is the purpose of this Constitution?
To fulfil the aspirations for sustainable peace, good governance, development and prosperity through the federal, democratic, republican, system of governance.
What is the status of this Constitution in Nepal?
This Constitution is the fundamental law of Nepal.
What should any law in Nepal be, in relation to this Constitution?
Any law inconsistent with this Constitution shall, to the extent of such inconsistency, be void.
What is the duty of every person in Nepal?
It shall be the duty of every person to observe this Constitution.
What is the sovereignty and state authority of Nepal vested in?
The sovereignty and state authority of Nepal is vested in the Nepalese people.
Who constitutes the nation of Nepal?

All the Nepalese people, with multiethnic, multilingual, multi-religious, multicultural characteristics and in geographical diversities, and having common aspirations and being united by a bond of allegiance to national independence, territorial integrity, national interest and prosperity of Nepal, collectively constitute the nation.
What is the state of Nepal?
Nepal is a n independent, indivisible, sovereign, secular, inclusive, democratic, socialism-oriented, federal democratic republican state.
What does the term'secular' mean in the context of the state of Nepal?
For the purposes of this Article,'secular' means religious, cultural freedoms, including protection of religion, culture handed down from
What are the cultural freedoms protected in Nepal?
cultural freedoms, including protection of religion, culture handed down from the time immemorial.
What does the territory of Nepal comprise?

The territory of Nepal shall comprise: (a) the territory existing at the time of commencement of this Constitution, and (b) such other territory as may be acquired after the commencement of this Constitution.
What is safeguarded for the national interest in Nepal?
Safeguarding of the freedom, sovereignty, territorial integrity, nationality, independence and dignity of Nepal, the rights of the
What are the basic elements of the national interest of Nepal?
Nepalese people, border security, ec onomic wellbeing and prosperity
What conduct and act are punishable by the Federal law in Nepal?
Any conduct and act contrary to the national interest
What are the languages of the nation in Nepal?
All languages spoken as the mother tongues in Nepal are the languages of the nation
What is the official language of Nepal in the Devnagari script?
The Nepali language
Can a State determine one or more than one languages of the nation spoken by a majority of people within the State as its official language(s), in addition to the Nepali language?
Yes
Who decides other matters relating to language in Nepal?
The Government of Nepal, on recommendation of the Language Commission
What is the national flag of Nepal?

The national flag of Nepal consists of two juxtaposed triangular figures with a crimson-coloured base and deep blue borders, there being a white emblem of the crescent moon with eight rays visible out of sixteen in the upper part and a white emblem of a twelve rayed sun in the lower part.
How is the national flag of Nepal drawn?
The method of drawing out the flag and other particulars relating thereto shall be as set forth in Schedule-1.
What is the national anthem of Nepal?
The national anthem of Nepal shall be as set forth in Schedule-2.
What is the national coat-of-arms of Nepal?
The coat-of-arms of Nepal shall be as set forth in Schedule-3.
What is the national flower of Nepal?
The Rhododendron Arboreum shall be the national flower of Nepal.
What is the national color of Nepal?
Crimson Colour shall be the national color of Nepal.
What is the national animal of Nepal?
The Cow shall be the national animal of Nepal.
What is the national bird of Nepal?
The Lophophorus shall be the national bird of Nepal.
What is not allowed in Nepal regarding citizenship?
No citizen of Nepal may be deprived of the right to obtain citizenship.
What is the provision of federal citizenship with State identity in Nepal?
There is a provision of single federal citizenship with State identity in Nepal.
What right cannot be deprived in Nepal?
The right to obtain citizenship cannot be deprived in Nepal.
What is the single federal citizenship with State identity in Nepal?
There is a provision of single federal citizenship with State identity in Nepal.
What is the right that cannot be taken away in Nepal?
The right to obtain citizenship cannot be taken away in Nepal.
Who are the citizens of Nepal according to the Constitution?

The persons who have obtained the citizenship of Nepal at the time of commencement of this Constitution and who are qualified to obtain citizenship in accordance with this Part shall be the citizens of Nepal.
Who can be a citizen of Nepal by descent?

The following person who has his or her permanent domicile in Nepal at the time of commencement of this Constitution shall be the citizen of Nepal by descent: (a) a person who has obtained the citizenship of Nepal by descent prior to the commencement of this Constitution, (b) a person whose father or mother was a citizen of Nepal at his or her birth.
What is the condition for a child to acquire citizenship of Nepal by descent?

A child of a citizen having obtained the citizenship of Nepal by birth prior to the commencement of Nepal shall, upon attaining majority, acquire the citizenship of Nepal by descent if the child's father and mother both are citizens of Nepal.
How can a child acquire the citizenship of Nepal by descent?
The child's father and mother both are citizens of Nepal.
What happens to a minor found within Nepal when the whereabouts of the father and mother are not known?
Until the father or the mother of the child is traced, the minor shall, by descent, be a citizen of Nepal.
What happens to a person who is born in Nepal from a woman who is a citizen of Nepal and has resided in Nepal, but whose father is not traced?
The person shall be provided with the citizenship of Nepal by descent.
What is the condition for a person born in Nepal to acquire citizenship by descent if the mother is a citizen of Nepal but the father is not traced?
The person shall be provided with the citizenship of Nepal by descent.
What is the condition for a person to acquire the citizenship of Nepal by descent if the mother is a citizen of Nepal but the father is not traced and the person is born in Nepal?
The person shall be provided with the citizenship of Nepal by descent.
What happens to a person if their father is a foreign citizen?
The citizenship of such person shall be converted into naturalized citizenship as provided for in the Federal law.
What can a foreign woman who is married to a citizen of Nepal do?
If she so wishes, she may acquire the naturalized citizenship of Nepal as provided for in the Federal law.
What is the condition for a person born from a woman who is a citizen of Nepal and married to a foreign citizen to acquire the naturalized citizenship of Nepal?
The person may acquire the naturalized citizenship of Nepal in accordance with the Federal law if he or she has permanently resided in Nepal and has not acquired the citizenship of a foreign country.
What happens if a person's mother and father are both citizens of Nepal at the time of acquisition of citizenship?
Such person born in Nepal may acquire the naturalized citizenship of Nepal.
What is the condition for a person born in Nepal to acquire the naturalized citizenship of Nepal if their mother is a citizen of Nepal and their father is a foreign citizen?
If he or she has permanently resided in Nepal and has not acquired the citizenship of a foreign country.
Who may acquire the citizenship of Nepal by descent?
A person born in Nepal
What is the method for acquiring citizenship of Nepal in cases other than those mentioned in the article?
The Government of Nepal may grant the naturalized citizenship of Nepal in accordance with the Federal law
What is the process for acquiring citizenship of Nepal by birth in Nepal?
A person born in Nepal may acquire the citizenship of Nepal by descent
What is the process for acquiring naturalized citizenship of Nepal?
The Government of Nepal may grant the naturalized citizenship of Nepal in accordance with the Federal law
What is the condition for acquiring naturalized citizenship of Nepal?
The condition is in accordance with the Federal law
What is the Government of Nepal allowed to do in accordance with the Federal law?
The Government of Nepal may grant the honorary citizenship of Nepal.
What happens to a person when any territory is acquired by way of merger into Nepal?
Whenever any territory is acquired by way of merger into Nepal, a person having his or her domicile in such territory shall become a citizen of Nepal, subject to the Federal law.
What is the process for a person who obtains the citizenship of Nepal by descent to obtain a certificate of citizenship of Nepal with gender identity?

A person who obtains the citizenship of Nepal by descent in accordance with this Constitution may obtain a certificate of citizenship of Nepal with gender identity by the name of his or her mother or father.
What are the matters relating to the acquisition, reacquisition and termination of citizenship?
Other matters relating to the acquisition, reacquisition and termination of citizenship shall be as provided for in the Federal law.
What is the right to live with dignity?
Every person shall have the right to live with dignity.
What is not allowed according to the right to live with dignity?
No law shall be made providing for the death penalty to any one.
What is the 17th fundamental right?
The 17th fundamental right is the right to live with dignity.
What is not allowed to be included in any law according to the right to live with dignity?
No law shall be made providing for the death penalty to any one.
What is the 16th fundamental right?
The 16th fundamental right is the right to live with dignity.
What is stated in the first line of the text?
No person shall be deprived of his or her personal liberty except in accordance with law.
What are the freedoms every citizen has according to the text?

Every citizen shall have the following freedoms: (a) freedom of opinion and expression, (b) freedom to assemble peaceably and without arms, (c) freedom to form political parties, (d) freedom to form unions and associations, (e) freedom to move and reside in any part of Nepal, (f) freedom to practice any profession, carry on any occupation, and establish and operate any industry, trade and business in any part of Nepal.
What is the restriction on freedom of opinion and expression according to the text?

Nothing in sub -clause (a) shall be deemed to prevent the making of an Act to impose reasonable restrictions on any act which may undermine the sovereignty, territorial integrity, nationality and independence of Nepal or the harmonious relations between the
What is the freedom to form political parties according to the text?
freedom to form political parties
What is the freedom to form unions and associations according to the text?
freedom to form unions and associations
What is not allowed to be the reason for the independence of Nepal?
the harmonious relations between the Federal Units
What is not allowed to be the reason for the independence of Nepal?
the people of various castes, tribes, religions or communities
What is not allowed to be the reason for the independence of Nepal?
incite caste-based discrimination or untouchability
What is not allowed to be the reason for the independence of Nepal?
on any act of disrespect of labour
What is not allowed to be the reason for the independence of Nepal?
defamation, contempt of court
What is not allowed to be the reason for the independence of Nepal?
incitement to an offence
What is not allowed to be the reason for the independence of Nepal?
on any act which may be contrary to public decency or morality
What is an act that may undermine the harmonious relations between the Federal Units?
an act which may undermine the harmonious relations between the Federal Units
What is an act of incitement to caste -based or communal hatred?
an act of incitement to caste -based or communal hatred
What is an act that may undermine the harmonious relations between various castes, tribes, religions and communities?
an act which may undermine the harmonious relations between various castes, tribes, religions and communities
What is an act of acquisition of, or restriction on, membership of any political party on the basis solely of tribe, language, religion, community or sex?
an act of acquisition of, or restriction on, membership of any political party on the basis solely of tribe, language, religion, community or sex
What is an act of formation of a political party with discrimination between citizens?
an act of formation of a political party with discrimination between citizens
What is an act of incitement to violent acts?
an act of incitement to violent acts
What is an act which may be contrary to public morality?
an act which may be contrary to public morality
What does sub-clause (d) not prevent?

The making of an Act to impose reasonable restrictions on any act which may undermine the sovereignty, territorial integrity, nationality and independence of Nepal, or on any act which may constitute espionage against the nation or on any act of divulgence of national secrecy or on any act assisting any foreign state, organization or
What acts does the sub-clause (d) potentially restrict?

Acts which may undermine the sovereignty, territorial integrity, nationality and independence of Nepal, acts which may constitute espionage against the nation, acts of divulgence of national secrecy, and acts assisting any foreign state, organization or
What is not considered as deeming to prevent the making of an Act according to sub-clause (d)?

The making of an Act to impose reasonable restrictions on any act which may undermine the sovereignty, territorial integrity, nationality and independence of Nepal, or on any act which may constitute espionage against the nation or on any act of divulgence of national secrecy or on any act assisting any foreign state, organization or
What acts does the text mention that may be considered as espionage against the nation?
Acts which may constitute espionage against the nation
What acts does the text mention that may be considered as divulgence of national secrecy?
Acts of divulgence of national secrecy
What is sub-clause (f) in the text not deemed to prevent?

The making of an Act to prevent any act which may undermine the harmonious relations between the Federal Units or any act which may be contrary to public health, decency or morality of the general public or to confer on the State the exclusive right to undertake any specific industry, trade or service, or to prescribe any condition or qualification for carrying on any industry, trade, occupation, employment or business.
What is the purpose of sub-clause (f) in the text?

Sub-clause (f) in the text does not prevent the making of an Act to prevent any act which may undermine the harmonious relations between the Federal Units or any act which may be contrary to public health, decency or morality of the general public or to confer on the State the exclusive right to undertake any specific industry, trade or service, or to prescribe any condition or qualification for carrying on any industry, trade, occupation, employment or business.
What is the subject matter of the text?
The subject matter of the text is laws or acts that may affect religions, communities, or industries.
What is the scope of the laws or acts mentioned in the text?
The laws or acts mentioned in the text may affect the Federal Units, the general public, or specific industries, trades, or services.
What is the purpose of the laws or acts mentioned in the text that may be contrary to public health, decency or morality?
The purpose of the laws or acts mentioned in the text that may be contrary to public health, decency or morality is not specified in the text.
What is the first right to equality?
All citizens shall be equal before law. No person shall be denied the equal protection of law.
What is the second right to equality?

No discrimination shall be made in the application of general laws on grounds of origin, religion, race, caste, tribe, sex, physical condition, condition of health, marital status, pregnancy, economic condition, language or region, ideology or on similar other grounds.
What is the first ground for which discrimination is prohibited?
origin
What is the second ground for which discrimination is prohibited?
religion
What is the third ground for which discrimination is prohibited?
race
What is the State not allowed to do according to the text?
The State shall not discriminate citizens on grounds of origin, religion, race, caste, tribe, sex, economic condition, language, region, ideology or on similar other grounds.
What is the provision that allows for the making of special provisions by law?
Nothing shall be deemed to prevent the making of special provisions by law for the protection, empowerment or development of the citizens.
Who are some of the groups that are specifically mentioned as being protected by the law?

The socially or culturally backward women, Dalit, indigenous people, indigenous nationalities, Madhesi, Tharu, Muslim, oppressed class, Pichhada class, minorities, the marginalized, farmers, labours, youths, children, senior citizens, gender and sexual minorities, persons with disabilities, persons in pregnancy, incapacitated or helpless, backward region and indigent Khas Arya.
What does the term 'indigent' mean for the purposes of this Part and Part 4?
For the purposes of this Part and Part 4, 'indigent' means a.
What is the explanation provided for the term 'indigent'?
For the purposes of this Part and Part 4, 'indigent' means a.
What is the subject matter that the law prohibits in any form of communication?

the law prohibits any act that may be contrary to public decency or morality, on any act of hatred to labour and on any act of incitement to caste-based untouchability as well as gender discrimination.
What is the provision regarding the closure, seizure, or cancellation of registration of any form of communication equipment?

No radio, television, on -line or other form of digital or electronic equipment, press or other means of communication publishing, broadcasting or printing any news item, feature, edit orial, article, information or other material shall be closed or seized nor shall registration thereof be cancelled nor shall such material be seized by the reason of publication, broadcasting or printing of such material through any audio, audio-visual or electronic equipment.
What is the provision that nothing contained in this clause shall be deemed to prevent?
the making of an Act to regulate radio, television, online or any other form of
What is the title of the Act being discussed?
the making of an Act to regulate radio, television, online or any other form of digital or electronic equipment, press or other means of communication.
What is the condition for interruption of means of communication?
No mean s of communication including the press, electronic broadcasting and telephone shall be interrupted except in accordance with law.
What is the right of a person who is arrested regarding informing about the ground for arrest?
No person shall be detained in custody without informing him or her of the ground for his or her arrest.
What is the right of a person who is arrested regarding consulting a legal practitioner?
Any person who is arrested shall have the right to consult a legal practitioner of his or her choice from the time of such arrest.
What is the provision regarding the confidentiality of consultation between a person and his or her legal practitioner?
Any consultation made by such person with, and advice given by, his or her legal practitioner shall be confidential.
What is the meaning of 'legal practitioner' according to the text?
any person who is authorized by law to represent any person in any court.
Who should be produced before the adjudicating authority within a period of twenty -four hours of arrest?
any person who is arrested
What is excluded from the 24-hour period for producing the arrested person before the adjudicating authority?
the time necessary for the journey from the place of arrest to such
What is the purpose of the clause mentioned in the text?
For the purpos e of this clause, 'legal practitioner' means any person who is authorized by law to represent any person in any court.
What is the time limit for producing an arrested person before the adjudicating authority?
within a period of twenty -four hours of such arrest
What is the condition for a person to be detained in custody?
a person shall not be detained in custody except on the order of such authority.
Who are exempted from the clause that a person shall not be detained in custody?
a person held in preventive detention and to a citizen of an enemy state.
What is the rule regarding punishment for an act not punishable by law at the time of commission?
No person shall be liable for punishment for an act which was not punishable by the law in force when the act was committed.
What is the presumption of innocence until proved guilty?
Every person charged with an offence shall be presumed innocent until proved guilty of the offence.
Can a person be tried and punished for the same offence in a court more than once?
No person shall be tried and punished for the same offence in a court more than once.
Can a person be compelled to testify against himself or herself?
No person charged with an offence shall be compelled to testify against himself or herself.
What is the right against oneself or oneself?
Every person shall have the right to be informed of any proceedings taken against him or her.
What is the right to be informed of?
Every person shall have the right to be informed of any proceedings taken against him or her.
What is the right to a fair trial by?
Every person shall have the right to a fair trial by an independent, impartial and competent court or judicial body.
Who has the right to free legal aid in accordance with law?
Any indigent  party shall have the right to free legal aid in accordance with law.
Who is entitled to free legal aid?
Any indigent  party shall have the right to free legal aid in accordance with law.
What is the right of a victim of crime?

A victim of crime shall have the right to get information about the investigation and proceedings of a case in which he or she is the victim. A victim of crime shall have the right to justice including social rehabilitation and compensation in accordance with law.
What is the right against torture?

No person who is arrested or detained shall be subjected to physical or mental torture or to cruel, inhuman or degrading treatment. Any act mentioned in clause (1) shall be punishable by law, and any person who is the victim of such treatment shall have the right to obtain compensation in accordance with law.
What is the right of a victim of crime regarding information?
A victim of crime shall have the right to get information about the investigation and proceedings of a case in which he or she is the victim.
What is the right of a victim of crime regarding justice?
A victim of crime shall have the right to justice including social rehabilitation and compensation in accordance with law.
What is the punishment for subjecting a person to physical or mental torture or to cruel, inhuman or degrading treatment?
Any act mentioned in clause (1) shall be punishable by law.
What is the condition for preventive detention in Nepal?

No person shall be held under preventive detention unless there is a sufficient ground of the existence of an immediate threat to the sovereignty, territorial integrity or public peace and order of Nepal.
What information must be given immediately to the family members or relatives of a person held under preventive detention in Nepal?
Information about the situation of a person who is held under preventive detention pursuant to clause (1) must be given immediately to his or her family members or relatives.
Who is exempted from the provision of immediate information to family members or relatives in case of preventive detention in Nepal?
This clause shall not apply to a citizen of an enemy state.
What rights does a person have if they are held under preventive detention contrary to law or in bad faith in Nepal?

If the authority making preventive detention holds any person under preventive detention contrary to law or in bad faith, the person held under preventive detention shall have the right to obtain compensation in accordance with law.
What is the right against untouchability and discrimination in Nepal?
No person shall be
What is the law in accordance with?
law
What is prohibited under the right against untouchability and discrimination (1) in private and public places?

No person shall be subjected to any form of untouchability or discrimination in any private and public places on grounds of his or her origin, caste, tribe, community, profession, occupation or physical condition.
What is prohibited under the right against untouchability and discrimination (2) in producing or distributing any goods, services or facilities?

In producing or distributing any goods, services or facilities, no person belonging to any particular caste or tribe shall be prevented from purchasing or acquiring such goods, services or facilities nor shall such goods, services or facilities be sold, distributed or provided only to the persons belonging to any particular caste or tribe.
Who is not allowed to be prevented from purchasing or acquiring goods, services or facilities under the right against untouchability and discrimination (2)?
No person belonging to any particular caste or tribe

Who is not allowed to sell, distribute or provide goods, services or facilities only to the persons belonging to any particular caste or tribe under the right against untouchability and discrimination (2)?
No person
What is not allowed according to point (3) of the text?

An act purporting to demonstrate any person or community as superior or inferior on grounds of origin, caste, tribe or physical condition or justifying social discrimination on grounds of caste, tribe or untouchability or propagating ideology based on untouchability and caste based superiority or hatred or encouraging caste -based discrimination in any manner whatsoever shall be allowed.
What is not allowed at a workplace according to point (4) of the text?
No discrimination in any form shall be allowed at a workplace with or without making untouchability on the ground of caste.
What is punishable by law as a severe social offence according to point (5) of the text?
Any act of untouchability and discrimination in any form committed in contravention of this Article shall be punishable by law as a severe social offence.
What right does the victim of such act have according to point (5) of the text?
The victim of such act shall have the right to obtain compensation in accordance with law.
What is not allowed in any form according to point (4) of the text?
Discrimination
What is the right of every citizen regarding property, subject to law?
Every citizen shall, subject to law, have the right to acquire, own, sell, dispose, acquire business profits from, and otherwise deal with, property.
What forms of property does the text mention?
The text mentions any form of property including movable and immovable property, and includes an intellectual property right.
What is the State allowed to do with a person's property, according to the text?
The State may levy tax on property of a person, and tax on income of a person in accordance with the concept of progressive taxation.
What is the State not allowed to do with a person's property, except for public interest?
The State shall not, except for public interest, requisition, acquire, or otherwise create any encumbrance on, property of a person.
What is the provision for property acquired illicitly?
This clause shall not apply to any property acquired by any person illicitly.
What is the basis of compensation to be provided when the State requisitions property of any person for public interest?
The basis of compensation to be provided is not specified in the text.
What procedures are to be followed in the requisition by the State of property of any person for public interest?
The procedures to be followed in the requisition by the State of property of any person for public interest are not specified in the text.
What follows in the requisition by the State of property of any person for public interest in accordance with clause (3)?
The property of any person for public interest in accordance with clause (3) shall be as provided for in the Act.
What is the action to be taken for the property of any person for public interest in accordance with clause (3)?
The property of any person for public interest in accordance with clause (3) shall be as provided for in the Act.
What is the provision for the property of any person for public interest in accordance with clause (3)?
The property of any person for public interest in accordance with clause (3) shall be as provided for in the Act.
What is the action that should be taken for the State's requisition of property of any person for public interest in accordance with clause (3)?
The property of any person for public interest in accordance with clause (3) shall be as provided for in the Act.
What is the action that the State should take for the property of any person for public interest in accordance with clause (3)?
The property of any person for public interest in accordance with clause (3) shall be as provided for in the Act.
What are the provisions of clauses (2) and (3) not preventing?

The provisions of clauses (2) and (3) shall not prevent the State from making land reforms, management and regulation in accordance with law for the purposes of enhancement of product and productivity of lands, modernization and commercialization of agriculture, environment protection and planned housing and urban development.
What is the purpose of clause (3) regarding the property of any person?

Nothing shall prevent the State from using the property of any person, which it has requisitioned for public interest in accordance with clause (3), for any other public interest instead of such public interest.
What are the purposes for which the State can make land reforms, management and regulation in accordance with law?

The State can make land reforms, management and regulation in accordance with law for the purposes of enhancement of product and productivity of lands, modernization and commercialization of agriculture, environment protection and planned housing and urban development.
What is the purpose of the provisions in clause (4)?

The provisions of clauses (2) and (3) shall not prevent the State from making land reforms, management and regulation in accordance with law for the purposes of enhancement of product and productivity of lands, modernization and commercialization of agriculture, environment protection and planned housing and urban development.
What is the purpose of clause (5)?

Nothing shall prevent the State from using the property of any person, which it has requisitioned for public interest in accordance with clause (3), for any other public interest instead of such public interest.
What is the freedom that every person who has faith in religion shall have according to Article 26?
Every person who has faith in religion shall have the freedom to profess, practice and protect his or her religion according to his or her conviction.
What right does every religious denomination have according to Article 26?
Every religious denomination shall have the right to operate and protect its religious sites and religious Guthi (trusts).
What is the provision regarding the regulation of the operation and protection of religious sites and religious trusts and management of trust properties and lands?
Nothing shall be deemed to prevent the regulation, by making law, of the operation and protection of religious sites and religious trusts and management of trust properties and lands.
What act is not allowed in the exercise of the right conferred by Article 26?

No person shall, in the exercise of the right conferred by this Article, do, or cause to be done, any act which may be contrary to public health, decency and morality or breach public peace, or convert another person from one religion to another or any act or conduct that may jeopardize others.
What is the restriction on the right to freedom of religion according to Article 26?
Provided that nothing shall be deemed to prevent the regulation, by making law, of the operation and protection of religious sites and religious trusts and management of trust properties and lands.
What is prohibited according to the text?
conversion from one religion to another or any act or conduct that may jeopardize other's religion.
What is the right to every citizen according to the text?
Every citizen shall have the right to demand and receive information on any matter of his or her interest or of public interest.
What is the condition for not being compelled to provide information according to the text?
no one shall be compelled to provide information on any matter of which confidentiality must be maintained in accordance with law.
What is the right to information subject to?

The senior-most Minister shall act as the Prime Minister until a new Prime Minister is appointed.
Can a person who is not a member of the Federal Parliament be appointed as a Minister?
Yes, on recommendation of the Prime Minister, the President may appoint a person who is not a member of the Federal Parliament as a Minister.
What must a Minister appointed under clause (1) of Article 78 do within six months from the date of taking oath?
A Minister appointed under clause (1) must obtain membership of the Federal Parliament.
What happens if a Minister appointed under clause (1) of Article 78 fails to obtain membership of the Federal Parliament within the period mentioned in clause (2)?
He or she shall not be a Minister.
What is stated in clause (2)?
Parliament within the period mentioned in clause (2), he or she shall not be qualified to be reappointed to the office of Minister during the term of the then House of Representatives.
What is not allowed according to clause (4)?

Notwithstanding anything contained in clause (1), a person who has been defeated in the election to the then House of Representatives shall not be qualified to be appointed to the office of Minister during the term of such House of Representatives.
What is the remuneration and other facilities of the Prime Minister and Ministers as per the text?
The remuneration and other facilities of the Prime Minister and Ministers shall be as provided for in the Federal Act, and shall be as specified by the Government of Nepal until such Act is made.
What is the source of the remuneration and other facilities of the Prime Minister and Ministers as per the text?
The remuneration and other facilities of the Prime Minister and Ministers shall be as provided for in the Federal Act, and shall be as specified by the Government of Nepal until such Act is made.
What is the title of section 79 as per the text?
Remuneration and other facilities of Prime Minister and Ministers
Who shall take an oath of office and secrecy?
The Prime Minister, Deputy Prime Minister and Ministers shall take an oath of office and secrecy.
Who shall the Prime Minister inform about the following matters?

The Prime Minister shall inform the President about the following matters: (a) resolutions of the Council of Ministers, (b) Bills to be introduced in the Federal Parliament, (c) such other necessary information as commanded by the President on matters set forth in clauses (a) and (b), and (d) current general state of affairs of the country and matters concerning foreign relations.
What are the matters that the Prime Minister shall inform the President about?

The Prime Minister shall inform the President about the following matters: (a) resolutions of the Council of Ministers, (b) Bills to be introduced in the Federal Parliament, (c) such other necessary information as commanded by the President on matters set forth in clauses (a) and (b), and (d) current general state of affairs of the country and matters concerning foreign relations.
Who shall Ministers of State and Assistant Ministers take their oath before?
Ministers of State and Assistant Ministers, before the Prime Minister.
What law provides for the oath of office and secrecy for the Prime Minister, Deputy Prime Minister and Ministers?
The oath of office and secrecy for the Prime Minister, Deputy Prime Minister and Ministers is provided for in the Federal law.
What is the business of the Government of Nepal?
The business of the Government of Nepal shall be allocated and transacted in accordance with the rules approved by the Government of Nepal.
Can the rules under clause (1) be questioned in any court?
No question may be raised in any court as to whether or not the rules under clause (1) have been observed.
What is the Federal Legislature?
There shall be a Federal Legislature consisting of two Houses to be known as the House of Representatives and the National Assembly, which shall be called as the Federal Parliament.
What are the two Houses of the Federal Legislature?
The two Houses of the Federal Legislature are the House of Representatives and the National Assembly.
What is the total number of members in the House of Representatives?
The total number of members in the House of Representatives is two hundred and seventy five.
How many members of the House of Representatives are elected through the first past the post electoral system?
One hundred and sixty five members of the House of Representatives are elected through the first past the post electoral system.
How many members of the House of Representatives are elected through the proportional electoral system?
One hundred and ten members of the House of Representatives are elected through the proportional electoral system.
What is the voting system for the House of Representatives in the country?
The whole country is considered as a single election constituency.
What does the Federal law provide for in terms of candidacy by political parties for the election to the House of Representatives under the proportional electoral system?
Representation shall be ensured on the basis of a closed list also from women, Dalit, indigenous peoples, Khas Arya, Madhesi, Tharu, Muslim s and backward regions, on the basis of population.

What is the basis of representation for women, Dalit, indigenous peoples, Khas Arya, Madhesi, Tharu, Muslim s and backward regions in the House of Representatives under the proportional electoral system?
Representation shall be ensured on the basis of a closed list also from women, Dalit, indigenous peoples, Khas Arya, Madhesi, Tharu, Muslim s and backward regions, on the basis of population.
Who are the groups that are ensured representation in the House of Representatives under the proportional electoral system?
Representation shall be ensured on the basis of a closed list also from women, Dalit, indigenous peoples, Khas Arya, Madhesi, Tharu, Muslim s and backward regions.
What is the basis of representation for each group in the House of Representatives under the proportional electoral system?
Representation shall be ensured on the basis of a closed list also from women, Dalit, indigenous peoples, Khas Arya, Madhesi, Tharu, Muslim s and backward regions, on the basis of population.
What is the purpose of the clause mentioned?
For the purpose s of this clause,  "Khas Arya " means Kshetri,  Brahmin, Thakuri, Sanyasi (Dashnami) community.
What does the term 'Khas Arya' refer to according to the text?
Kshetri,  Brahmin, Thakuri, Sanyasi (Dashnami) community.
What is the consideration for fielding candidacy as per the text?
Regard shall also be had to geography and territorial  balance.
What is the requirement for political parties in fielding candidacy under clause (2) as per the text?
Political parties shall provide for representation of the persons with disabilities as well.
What does the term 'Khas Arya' mean in the context of the political representation?
Kshetri,  Brahmin, Thakuri, Sanyasi (Dashnami) community.
What is the method for holding elections to the House of Representatives under clause (1)?
Election to the House of Representatives under clause (1) shall be held through secret ballots in accordance with law.
What is the minimum age for a citizen of Nepal to have the right to vote in any one election constituency?
Each citizen of Nepal who has completed the age of eighteen years shall have the right to vote in any one election constituency as provided for in the Federal law.
Who is qualified to be a candidate in any election constituency for the members of the House of Representatives?

A person who is qualified under Article 87 and entitled to vote in an election to the members of the House of Representatives may, subject to the Federal law, be a candidate in any election constituency.
Is it allowed for a person to be a candidate in more than one election constituency at the same time?
A person shall not be a candidate in more than one election constituencies at the same time.
What happens if the seat of any member of the House of Representatives falls vacant while its term still remains for more than six months?

If the seat of any member of the House of Representatives falls vacant while its term still remains for more than six months, the vacancy shall be filled in the same manner of electoral system as in which such seat was.
What should be filled in the same manner of electoral system as in which such seat was filled in?
the same manner of electoral system
What is the minimum number of members elected from each political party representing in the Federal Parliament that must be women?
at least one third of the total number of members
What happens if women are not so elected as to constitute one third of the elected members of any political party under sub-clause (a) of clause (1) and sub-clause (a) of clause (2) of Article 86?

such political party must, in electing members under sub -clause (b) of clause (1), so elect that women members constitute at least one third of the total number of members elected to the Federal Parliament from that party.
Where can we find the rules for election to the House of Representatives and other matters pertaining thereto?
as provided for in the Federal law
What is the title of the article that contains the rules about the minimum number of women members in the Federal Parliament?
Article 86
What is the term of the House of Representatives unless dissolved earlier pursuant to this Constitution?
The term of the House of Representatives shall be five years.
Can the term of the House of Representatives be extended?
Yes, the term of the House of Representatives may be extended by a Federal Act for a period not exceeding one year in cases where a proclamation or order of a state of emergency is in effect.
For how long can the term of the House of Representatives be extended?
The term of the House of Representatives may be extended for a period not exceeding one year.
What happens to the term of the House of Representatives when the state of emergency is voided?

The term of the House of Representatives extended under clause (2) shall ipso facto expire upon the expiry of six months from the date of voidance of the proclamation or order of the state of emergency.
What is the maximum duration for which the term of the House of Representatives can be extended during a state of emergency?
The term of the House of Representatives can be extended for a maximum duration of one year during a state of emergency.
What is the composition of the National Assembly?
The National Assembly shall consist of fifty nine members as follows:
How many elected members are there in the National Assembly?
There are fifty six elected members in the National Assembly.
What are the minimum categories of elected members in the National Assembly?
The minimum categories of elected members in the National Assembly are at least three women, one Dalit and one from persons with disabilities or minorities.
From which bodies are the elected members chosen?
The elected members are chosen from the State Assembly, chairpersons and vice -chairpersons of the Village Bodies, and Mayors and Deputy -Mayors of the Municipalities.
How are the three nominated members chosen?
The three nominated members are chosen by nominating at least one woman.
What are municipalities provided for in the Federal law?
Municipalities
How are three members of the National Assembly nominated?
On recommendation of the Government of Nepal by the President
What is the term of office of the members of the National Assembly?
Six years
What is the term of office of one third of the members of the National Assembly that expires every two years?
One third of the members of the National Assembly
What arrangements will be made for the first time after the commencement of the Constitution for the National Assembly?
Arrangements shall be made by drawing lots to retire one -third of the members of the National Assembly
How are the members of the National Assembly elected?
Other matters relating to election to the members of the National Assembly shall be as provided for in the Federal law.
What is the term of office of the members of the National Assembly for the first time after the commencement of this Constitution?
The term of office of all members shall be deemed to have commenced on the day on which the first session of the National Assembly is held.
How are vacancies in the National Assembly filled?

Any vacancy of seat in the National Assembly shall be filled for the remainder of the term of office in the same manner of el ection or nomination as in which the seat of the vacating member was filled.
How are the terms of office of the members on the National Assembly distributed?
The members on the expiry of two years, another one-third on the expiry of four years, and the final one-third on the expiry of six years.
What happens if a member's seat becomes vacant before the end of their term?

Any vacancy of seat in the National Assembly shall be filled for the remainder of the term of office in the same manner of el ection or nomination as in which the seat of the vacating member was filled.
What is the qualification for a person to become a member of the Federal Parliament in Nepal?

A person who has the following qualification shall be qualified to become a member of the Federal Parliament: (a) being a citizen of Nepal, (b) having completed the age of twenty five years, for the House of Representatives, and the age of thirty five years, for the National Assembly,   (c) not having been convicted of a criminal offense involving moral turpitude,   (d) not being disqualified by any Federal law, and (e) not holding any office of profit.
What is the age requirement for the House of Representatives in the Federal Parliament of Nepal?
The age requirement for the House of Representatives in the Federal Parliament of Nepal is twenty five years.
What is the age requirement for the National Assembly in the Federal Parliament of Nepal?
The age requirement for the National Assembly in the Federal Parliament of Nepal is thirty five years.
What is considered an 'office of profit' for the purposes of the Federal Parliament of Nepal?

For the purposes of this clause, 'office of profit' means any position, other than a political position which is to be filled by election or nomination, for which a remuneration or economic benefit is paid out of a government fund.
Can a person be a member of both Houses of the Federal Parliament of Nepal at the same time?
No person may be a member of both Houses at the same time.
What happens to a person who holds a political office and is elected or nominated as a member of the Federal Parliament under this Part?
His or her such office shall ipso facto be vacant from the day on which he or she takes an oath of office of member of the Federal Parliament.
What must every member of each House of the Federal Parliament do before taking part for the first time in the session of the House or any of its committees?
He or she must take an oath as provided for in the Federal law.
What are the circumstances under which the seat of a member of the Federal Parliament shall become vacant?

The seat of a member of the Federal Parliament shall become vacant in any of the following circumstances: (a) if he or she tenders resignation in writing before the Speaker or Chairperson, (b) if he or she is no longer qualified or ceases to possess the qualification under Article 87.
What is the oath that every member of each House of the Federal Parliament must take?
Every member of each House of the Federal Parliament must, before taking part for the first time in the session of the House or any of its committees, take an oath as provided for in the Federal law.
What happens to a person's political office if he or she is elected or nominated as a member of the Federal Parliament and takes an oath of office of member of the Federal Parliament?
His or her such office shall ipso facto be vacant from the day on which he or she takes an oath of office of member of the Federal Parliament.
What are the conditions for a member of the National Assembly to be removed from office?

A member of the National Assembly can be removed from office if he or she is no longer qualified or ceases to possess the qualification under Article 87, if the term of the House of Representatives or the term of office of the member of the National Assembly expires, if he or she absents himself or herself from ten consecutive meetings, without giving notice to the concerned House, if the political party of which he or she was a member when elected provides a notification in accordance with the Federal law that he or she has defected from the party, if he or she dies.
What happens if the term of the House of Representatives or the term of office of the member of the National Assembly expires?
If the term of the House of Representatives or the term of office of the member of the National Assembly expires, the member can be removed from office.
What happens if a member of the National Assembly absents himself or herself from ten consecutive meetings?
If a member of the National Assembly absents himself or herself from ten consecutive meetings, without giving notice to the concerned House, the member can be removed from office.
What happens if the political party of which a member of the National Assembly was a member when elected provides a notification that he or she has defected from the party?

If the political party of which a member of the National Assembly was a member when elected provides a notification in accordance with the Federal law that he or she has defected from the party, the member can be removed from office.
What happens if a member of the National Assembly dies?
If a member of the National Assembly dies, the member can be removed from office.
Who decides if a member of the Federal Parliament is disqualified or has become disqualified under Article 87?
The Constitutional Bench of the Supreme Court shall finally decide that question.
What body is responsible for deciding if a member of the Federal Parliament is disqualified or has become disqualified under Article 87?
The Constitutional Bench of the Supreme Court shall finally decide that question.
What is the final decision-making body for questions arising as to whether any member of the Federal Parliament is disqualified or has become disqualified under Article 87?
The Constitutional Bench of the Supreme Court shall finally decide that question.
What body is responsible for making the final decision on questions arising as to whether any member of the Federal Parliament is disqualified or has become disqualified under Article 87?
The Constitutional Bench of the Supreme Court shall finally decide that question.
Who is responsible for making the final decision on questions arising as to whether any member of the Federal Parliament is disqualified or has become disqualified under Article 87?
The Constitutional Bench of the Supreme Court shall finally decide that question.
What is the time limit for the members of the House of Representatives to elect a Speaker and a Deputy Speaker?
The members of the House of Representatives shall, not later than fifteen days of the date of holding of the first meeting of the House of Representatives, elect a Speaker and a Deputy Speaker.
What is the requirement for the Speaker and the Deputy Speaker in terms of gender?
There is one woman out of the Speaker and the Deputy Speaker.
What is the requirement for the Speaker and the Deputy Speaker in terms of party representation?
The Speaker and the Deputy Speaker of the House of Representatives shall be representatives from different parties.
What happens if there is no representation of more than one party in the House of Representatives or no candidacy is filed by more parties?
Nothing shall prevent the members of the same party from being the Speaker and the Deputy Speaker of the House of Representatives.
What is the provision for the Speaker and the Deputy Speaker if there is no representation of more than one party in the House of Representatives or no candidacy is filed by more parties?

If there is no representation of more than one party in the House of Representatives or no candidacy is filed by more than one party, nothing shall prevent the members of the same party from being the Speaker and the Deputy Speaker of the House of Representatives.
Who can be the Speaker and the Deputy Speaker of the House of Representatives?
The members of the House of Representatives
How is the office of the Speaker or the Deputy Speaker filled if it falls vacant?
The members of the House of Representatives shall fill the vacancy by electing the Speaker or Deputy Speaker from amongst themselves.
What is the process for electing the Speaker or Deputy Speaker of the House of Representatives?
The members of the House of Representatives shall fill the vacancy by electing the Speaker or Deputy Speaker from amongst themselves.
Can the Speaker or Deputy Speaker of the House of Representatives be anyone other than a member of the House of Representatives?
No, the Speaker or Deputy Speaker of the House of Representatives must be a member of the House of Representatives.
Is there a specific order in which the Speaker or Deputy Speaker of the House of Representatives is elected if the office falls vacant?
No, the text does not specify a specific order for the election of the Speaker or Deputy Speaker if the office falls vacant.
Who chairs the House of Representatives in the absence of the Speaker?
The Deputy Speaker
What happens if election to the Speaker and the Deputy Speaker is not held or if both the positions become vacant?
The attending member who is by age the senior-most shall chair the meeting of the House of Representatives.
What are the circumstances under which the office of the Speaker or Deputy Speaker of the House of Representatives becomes vacant?

The office of the Speaker or Deputy Speaker of the House of Representatives becomes vacant in any of the following circumstances: (a) if he or she ceases to be a member of the House of Representatives, Provided that, in the event of dissolution of the House of Representatives, the Speaker and the Deputy Speaker of the House of Representatives shall continue to hold office until the new Speaker and Deputy Speaker are elected.
What happens to the Speaker and the Deputy Speaker of the House of Representatives in the event of dissolution of the House of Representatives?
The Speaker and the Deputy Speaker of the House of Representatives shall continue to hold office until the new Speaker and Deputy Speaker are elected.
What is the role of the Deputy Speaker in the House of Representatives?
The Deputy Speaker shall, in the absence of the Speaker, chair the House of Representatives.
What is the duration of House of Representatives holding their respective offices until the previous day of the filing of nominations for another election to the House of Representatives?
House of Representatives holding their respective offices continue in office until the previous day of the filing of nominations for another election to the House of Representatives.
What is the condition for a member of the House of Representatives to tender resignation?
A member of the House of Representatives tenders resignation in writing.
What is the condition for a resolution to be passed that the conduct of a member of the House of Representatives is not compatible with his or her office?
A resolution is passed by a majority of two -thirds of the total number of the then members of the House of Representatives that his or her conduct is not compatible with his or her office.
Who chairs a meeting at which deliberations are to be held on a resolution that the conduct of the Speaker of the House of Representatives is not compatible with his or her office?

The Deputy Speaker shall chair a meeting at which deliberations are to be held on a resolution that the conduct of the Speaker of the House of Representatives is not compatible with his or her office.
Can the Speaker of the House of Representatives take part and vote in the deliberations on a resolution that his or her conduct is not compatible with his or her office?
The Speaker of the House of Representatives may take part and vote in the deliberations on such resolution.
Who are elected by the members of the National Assembly not later than fifteen days of the date of holding its first meeting?
The Chairperson and the Vice-Chairperson of the National Assembly
What is the requirement for the Chairperson and the Vice-Chairperson of the National Assembly?
There is one woman out of the Chairperson and the Vice-Chairperson of the National Assembly
What happens if the office of the Chairperson or Vice-Chairperson of the National Assembly falls vacant?
The members of the National Assembly shall fill the vacancy by electing its Chairperson or Vice-Chairperson from amongst themselves
Who chairs the National Assembly in the absence of its Chairperson?
The Vice -Chairperson of the National Assembly
What is the process for electing the Chairperson and the Vice-Chairperson of the National Assembly?
The members of the National Assembly shall elect the Chairperson and the Vice-Chairperson of the National Assembly from amongst themselves
What is the National Assembly?
National Assembly is not specified in the text.
What happens when the National Assembly is not held?
The text does not specify what happens when the National Assembly is not held.
What happens if both the positions become vacant in the National Assembly?
The text does not specify what happens if both the positions become vacant in the National Assembly.
What is the position that becomes vacant in the National Assembly?
The text does not specify the position that becomes vacant in the National Assembly.
What is the process for filling a vacant position in the National Assembly?
The text does not specify the process for filling a vacant position in the National Assembly.
Who may take part and vote in the deliberations on a resolution in the National Assembly?
The Chairperson of the National Assembly may take part and vote in the deliberations on such resolution.
What is the role of the Chairperson of the National Assembly in the deliberations on a resolution?
The Chairperson of the National Assembly may take part and vote in the deliberations on such resolution.
Can the Chairperson of the National Assembly vote in the deliberations on a resolution in the National Assembly?
Yes, the Chairperson of the National Assembly may vote in the deliberations on a resolution in the National Assembly.
What is the subject of the resolution that the Chairperson of the National Assembly can vote on?
The resolution that the Chairperson of the National Assembly can vote on is not specified.
What is the title of the person who can vote on a resolution in the National Assembly?
The title of the person who can vote on a resolution in the National Assembly is not specified.
What is the President required to do within thirty days of the declaration of final results of the election to the House of Representatives?
The President shall summon a session of the Federal Parliament.
What is the maximum interval between two consecutive sessions of the Federal Parliament?
The interval between the two consecutive sessions shall not exceed six months.
What power does the President have regarding the summoning of sessions of the Federal Parliament?
The President shall, from time to time, summon sessions of both or either of the Houses pursuant to this Constitution.
What power does the President have to extend the duration of a session of the Federal Parliament?
The President may prorogue the session of both or either of the Houses of the Federal Parliament.

What action can be taken if one-fourth of the total number of members of the House of Representatives believe it is desirable to convene a session or meeting during the prorogation or recess of the session of the House of Representatives?

If, during the prorogation or recess of the session of the House of Representatives, one-fourth of the total number of its members write a petition that it is desirable to convene a session or meeting, the President shall specify a time for the session or meeting to be held.
What is the rule for the House of Representatives to meet or commence its session?
The House of Representatives shall meet or commence its session at the date and time so specified.
What is the quorum for a meeting of either House of the Federal Parliament?

Except as otherwise provided in this Constitution, no question or resolution shall be presented for decis ion in a meeting of either House of the Federal Parliament unless one -fourth of the total number of its members are present.
What is the power of the President to address a meeting or a joint sitting of both Houses of the Federal Parliament?
The President may address either a meeting of any House or a joint sitting of both Houses of the Federal Parliament, and summon the members for that purpose.
What is the obligation of the President to address the first session after election to the House of Representatives?
The President shall address the first session after election to the House of Representatives.
What are the positions mentioned in the text?
The positions mentioned in the text are the President, Deputy Prime Minister, Minister, Minister of State and Assistant Minister.
Who is entitled to attend and take part in the proceedings and deliberations of either House of the Federal Parliament or its committees?
The Deputy Prime Minister, Minister, Minister of State and Assistant Minister
Who is entitled to vote in a House or its committee of which he or she is not a member?
No one is entitled to vote in a House or its committee of which he or she is not a member.
What are the Deputy Prime Minister, Minister, Minister of State and Assistant Minister entitled to do in the proceedings and deliberations of the committees of the Federal Parliament?
The Deputy Prime Minister, Minister, Minister of State and Assistant Minister are entitled to attend and take part in the proceedings and deliberations of the committees of the Federal Parliament.
What are the Deputy Prime Minister, Minister, Minister of State and Assistant Minister not entitled to do in the committees of the Federal Parliament?
The Deputy Prime Minister, Minister, Minister of State and Assistant Minister are not entitled to vote in a House or its committee of which he or she is not a member.
Where are the Deputy Prime Minister, Minister, Minister of State and Assistant Minister entitled to attend and take part in the proceedings and deliberations of?

The Deputy Prime Minister, Minister, Minister of State and Assistant Minister are entitled to attend and take part in the proceedings and deliberations of either House of the Federal Parliament or its committees.
What can the House of Representatives and the National Assembly form?
The House of Representatives and the National Assembly may form committees as provided for in the Federal law.
What happens if a resolution is passed by either House demanding a joint committee?

If a resolution is passed by either House demanding that a joint committee of both the Houses be formed for the purpose of managing the working procedures between the two Houses of the Federal Parliament, resolving disagreement on any Bill or for any other specified function, the joint committee shall be formed.
What is the maximum number of members in a joint committee?
The joint committee shall consist of a maximum of members.
What is the purpose of a joint committee according to the text?

The purpose of a joint committee, according to the text, is to manage the working procedures between the two Houses of the Federal Parliament, resolve disagreement on any Bill, or perform any other specified function.
What is the minimum number of members in a joint committee?
The text does not provide information about the minimum number of members in a joint committee.
How many members are there in the Federal Parliament?
The text does not specify the total number of members in the Federal Parliament.
What is the ratio of members from the House of Representatives to members from the National Assembly?
The ratio is twenty five members from the House of Representatives to one member from the National Assembly.
What happens if there is a vacancy in the seat of a member in either House of the Federal Parliament?
Either House of the Federal Parliament shall have the power to transact its business notwithstanding any vacancy in the seat of its member.
Can proceedings of either House of the Federal Parliament become invalid if it is subsequently discovered that a person who was not entitled took part in such proceedings?
No, proceedings of either House of the Federal Parliament shall not become invalid even if it is subsequently discovered that a person who was not so entitled took part in such proceedings.
How are motions submitted for decision in either House of the Federal Parliament decided?

Any motions submitted for decision in either House of the Federal Parliament shall be decided by a majority vote of the members present and voting. The member chairing the meeting shall not have the right to vote, but may cast a vote in the case of a tie.
What action can the Prime Minister take to show confidence from the House of Representatives?
The Prime Minister may table a motion to that effect in the House of Representatives for the vote of confidence.
What happens if the political party which the Prime Minister represents is divided or a political party in coalition government withdraws its support?
The Prime Minister shall table a motion in the House of Representatives for a vote of confidence within thirty days.
What is the consequence if a motion tabled under clauses (1) and (2) is not passed by a majority of the total number of the then members of the House of Representatives?
The Prime Minister shall relieve of his or her office.

What is the time limit for tabling a motion in the House of Representatives for a vote of confidence if the political party which the Prime Minister represents is divided or a political party in coalition government withdraws its support?

If a motion tabled under clauses (1) and (2) is not passed by a majority of the total number of the then members of the House of Representatives, the Prime Minister shall table a motion in the House of Representatives for a vote of confidence within thirty days.
What is the minimum number of votes required to pass a motion tabled under clauses (1) and (2)?
The motion tabled under clauses (1) and (2) must be passed by a majority of the total number of the then members of the House of Representatives.
What is the minimum number of members of the House of Representatives required to table a motion of no-confidence in writing?
One-fourth of the total number of the then members of the House of Representatives
What is the minimum time period after the appointment of the Prime Minister before a motion of no confidence can be tabled?
The motion of no confidence shall not be tabled until the first two years after the appointment of the Prime Minister
What is the minimum time period after the failure of a motion of no confidence before another motion can be tabled?
Until another one year after the date of failure of the motion of no confidence once tabled.
What should a motion of no confidence tabled under clause (4) indicate?
A motion of no confidence tabled under clause (4) shall also indicate the name of a member proposed for the Prime Minister.
What happens if a motion of no confidence tabled under clause (4) is passed by a majority of the total number of the then members of the House of Representatives?

If a motion of no confidence tabled under clause (4) is passed by a majority of the total number of the then members of the House of Representatives, the Prime Minister shall relieve of his or her office.
What happens if the office of Prime Minister falls vacant because of the passage of a motion of no confidence?
If the office of Prime Minister falls vacant because of the passage of a motion of no confidence, it is not specified in the text.
What action does the President take when a motion of no confidence under clause (6) is presented?
The President shall, in accordance with Article 76, appoint as the Prime Minister the member of the House of Representatives proposed under clause (5).
What is the title of the article that contains this information?
This information is not provided in the text.
What is the name of the House of Representatives member who will be appointed as the Prime Minister?
The name of the House of Representatives member who will be appointed as the Prime Minister is not provided in the text.
What is the purpose of clause (5) in this context?
Clause (5) in this context is used to propose a member of the House of Representatives to be appointed as the Prime Minister.
What is the name of the article that this information is taken from?
The name of the article is not provided in the text.
What is the minimum number of members of the House of Representatives required to move a motion of impeachment against the President or Vice -President?
One fourth of the total number of the then members of the House of Representatives

What is the minimum number of members of the House of Representatives required to move a motion of impeachment against the Chief Justice of Nepal or a Judge of the Supreme Court, member of the Judicial Council, chief or official of a Constitutional Body?
One fourth of the total number of the then members of the House of Representatives
What are the grounds for impeachment against the President or Vice -President?
Serious violation of this Constitution and the Federal law
What are the grounds for impeachment against the Chief Justice of Nepal or a Judge of the Supreme Court, member of the Judicial Council, chief or official of a Constitutional Body?
His or her failure to fulfil his or her duties of office because of serious violation of this Constitution and law, incompetence or misconduct or failure to discharge the duties of office

What happens if the motion of impeachment against the President or Vice -President is passed by at least two thirds majority of the total number of the then members of both Houses of the Federal Parliament?
He or she shall relive of his or her office
What are the duties of an office holder?
duties of office
What is the consequence for not performing duties of office honestly?
serious violation of the code of conduct
What is the consequence for a serious violation of the code of conduct?
may result in removal from office
What is the code of conduct for office holders?
not specified in the text
What is the process for removing an office holder for a serious violation of the code of conduct?
not specified in the text
What is the condition for a motion to be passed in the House of Representatives that results in a person being relieved of their office?
The motion is passed by at least two thirds majority of the total number of the members of the House of Representatives.
What happens to the concerned person if the motion is passed as per the condition mentioned in the text?
The concerned person shall relieve of his or her office.
What is the purpose of the impeachment recommendation committee in the House of Representatives?

The purpose of the impeachment recommendation committee in the House of Representatives is to make a recommendation after inquiring into whether there exist the ground and reason for moving a motion of impeachment against any person under clause (2).
How many members does the committee under clause (3) consist of?
The committee under clause (3) shall consist of eleven members of the House of Representatives.
What is the condition for at least three members of the House of Representatives to certify and submit a petition?

At least three members of the House of Representatives certify and submit a petition that the received information, notice or petition is admissible on the ground of serious violation of the Constitution or incompetence or misconduct or failure to discharge the duties of office.
What is a ground for impeachment under clause (1) in Nepal?
incompetence or misconduct or failure to discharge the duties of office honestly or serious violation of the code of conduct by the person relieving of office
What is the role of the committee under clause (3) in Nepal?
upon inquiring into such petition in accordance with Federal law, makes recommendation to the House of Representatives for impeachment proceedings
What happens after the commencement of impeachment proceedings under clause (2) in Nepal?
A person who is charged with impeachment under clause (1) or shall not be allowed to discharge the duties of his or her office pending the settlement of such proceedings
Who presides over impeachment proceedings in Nepal?
The Chief Justice of Nepal or Judge of the Supreme Court
What is the consequence of a motion of impeachment under clause (2) in Nepal?
a motion of impeachment under clause (2) may be moved
What is provided to a person who is charged with impeachment under clause (1) or (2)?
A reasonable opportunity to defend himself or herself.

A person who is charged with impeachment under clause (1) or (2)

Clause (1) or (2)

To defend himself or herself.
