The number of members in a State Assembly shall be set on the basis of geography and population as provided for in the Federal law.
What is the method for electing members under sub-clause (a) of clause (1) as provided for in the Federal law?
The method for electing members under sub-clause (a) of clause (1) as provided for in the Federal law is not specified in the text.
What percentage of members of the State Assembly are elected in accordance with the first past the post electoral system?
Sixty percent members of the State Assembly are elected in accordance with the first past the post electoral system.
What percentage of members of the State Assembly are elected in accordance with the proportional electoral system?
Forty percent members of the State Assembly are elected in accordance with the proportional electoral system.
What is the total number of members of the State Assembly?
The text does not provide the total number of members of the State Assembly.
What is the electoral system for the remaining members of the State Assembly (not elected by the first past the post or proportional electoral system)?
The text does not specify the electoral system for the remaining members of the State Assembly.
What is the method of election to the members of the State Assembly under clause (3)?
Election to the members of the State Assembly under clause (3) shall be held through adult suffrage by secret ballots in accordance with law.
Who has the right to vote in any one election constituency in Nepal?
Each citizen of Nepal who resides within the territory of the State and who has completed the age of eighteen years shall have a right to vote in any one election constituency in accordance with law.
What is the requirement for citizens of Nepal to vote in an election constituency?
Each citizen of Nepal who resides within the territory of the State and who has completed the age of eighteen years shall have a right to vote in any one election constituency in accordance with law.
What is the method of fielding candidacy by political parties for the election to the State Assembly under the proportional electoral system?
Representation shall be ensured on the basis of a closed list.
What is the Federal law required to provide for the election to the State Assembly under the proportional electoral system?

The Federal law shall provide that, in fielding candidacy by political parties for the election to the State Assembly under the proportional electoral system, representation shall be ensured on the basis of a closed list.
Who are the communities mentioned in the text?
women, Dalit, indigenous, indigenous nationalities, Khas Arya, Madhesi, Tharu, Muslims, backward regions, minority communities
What does 'Khas Arya' mean in the context of this text?
Kshetri, Brahmin, Thakuri, Sanyasi (Dashnami) community
What is the requirement for political parties in fielding candidacy under clause (6) of the text?
Political parties must provide for representation of the persons with disabilities as well.
What is the consideration for geographical balance of the concerned state?
Regard shall also be had to geographical balance of the concerned State.
What is the population basis for representation in the field mentioned in the text?
on the basis of population
What happens if the seat of a member of the State Assembly falls vacant while its term still remains for more than six months?
The vacancy shall be filled through the same electoral system as through which such seat was filled in.
What is the requirement for the number of women in a political party representing in the State Assembly?
At least one third of the total number of members elected from each political party representing in the State Assembly must be women.
What happens if a political party does not have one third of the elected members as women?
Such political party must, in electing members, so elect that women members constitute at least one third of the total number of members elected to the State Assembly from that party.
Who is qualified to be a member of the State Assembly?
A person who is qualified under Article 178 and entitled to vote.
What is the term of the State Assembly according to the Constitution?
Unless dissolved earlier pursuant to this Constitution, the term of the State Assembly shall be five years.
Can the term of the State Assembly be extended?
Yes, the term of the State Assembly may be extended by a State Act for a period not exceeding one year in cases where a proclamation or order of a state of emergency is in effect.
For how long can the term of the State Assembly be extended?

The term of the State Assembly extended under clause (2) shall ipso facto be terminated after the expiry of six months from the date of voidance of the proclamation or order of the state of emergency in the concerned State.
What are the qualifications for a person to become a member of the State Assembly?
A person who has the following qualification shall be qualified to become a member of the State Assembly: (a) being a citizen of Nepal, (b) being a voter of the concerned State.
What are the two qualifications for a person to become a member of the State Assembly?
A person who has the following qualification shall be qualified to become a member of the State Assembly: (a) being a citizen of Nepal, (b) being a voter of the concerned State.
What are the conditions to be a member of the Assembly in Nepal?

being a citizen of Nepal, being a voter of the concerned State, having completed the age of twenty five years, not having been convicted of a criminal offense involving moral turpitude, not being disqualified by any law, and not holding any office of profit.
What is the definition of 'office of profit' in the context of the Assembly in Nepal?
any position, other than a political position which is to be filled by election or nomination, for which a remu neration or economic benefit is paid out of a government fund.
What are the conditions for a person to be eligible to be a member of the Assembly in Nepal?

being a citizen of Nepal, being a voter of the concerned State, having completed the age of twenty five years, not having been convicted of a criminal offense involving moral turpitude, not being disqualified by any law, and not holding any office of profit.
What are the disqualifications for a person to be a member of the Assembly in Nepal?
not having been convicted of a criminal offense involving moral turpitude, not being disqualified by any law, and not holding any office of profit.
What is the minimum age requirement to be a member of the Assembly in Nepal?
having completed the age of twenty five years
What is the method for filling a political office?
The method for filling a political office can be by election, nomination, or appointment.
What type of person holds a political office?
A person who holds a political office is a person who has been elected, nominated, or appointed.
What is the office that a person elected as a member of the State holds?
The office that a person elected as a member of the State holds is not specified in the text.
What is the process for becoming a member of the State?
The text does not specify the process for becoming a member of the State.
What type of office is being filled by election, nomination, or appointment?
The text does not specify the type of office being filled by election, nomination, or appointment.
What are the conditions for a member of the State Assembly to be disqualified?

if he or she absents himself or herself from ten consecutive meetings, without giving notice to the State Assembly, if the political party of which he or she was a member when elected provides a notification as provided for in the Federal law that he or she has defected from the party, If he or she dies.
What body makes the final decision of a question as to whether any member of the State Assembly is disqualified or has ceased to possess any of the qualifications under Article 178?
The Constitutional Bench of the Supreme Court shall make the final decision of such question.
What happens if a question arises as to whether any member of the State Assembly is disqualified or has ceased to possess any of the qualifications under Article 181?

If a question arises as to whether any member of the State Assembly is disqualified or has ceased to possess any of the qualifications under Article 178, the Constitutional Bench of the Supreme Court shall make the final decision of such question.
Who are the members of the State Assembly?
The members of the State Assembly
What is the time limit for the members of the State Assembly to elect a State Speaker and a Deputy State Speaker?
not later than fifteen days of the date of holding of the first meeting of the State Assembly
What positions are to be filled by the members of the State Assembly?
a State Speaker and a Deputy State Speaker
From where are the State Speaker and the Deputy State Speaker to be elected?
from amongst themselves
When should the members of the State Assembly hold the first meeting?
not later than fifteen days of the date of holding of the first meeting of the State Assembly
What is the requirement for the election of the State Speaker and the Deputy State Speaker under clause (1) of the text?

There must be one woman out of the State Speaker and the Deputy State Speaker, and the State Speaker and the Deputy State Speaker of the State Assembly shall be representatives from different parties.
What happens if there is no representation of more than one party in the State Assembly or no candidacy is filed by more than one party despite representation?
Nothing shall prevent the members of the same party from being the State Speaker and the Deputy State Speaker of the State Assembly.
What is the process for filling a vacancy in the office of the State Speaker or the Deputy State Speaker?
The members of the State Assembly shall fill the vacancy through election to the State Speaker or the Deputy State Speaker from amongst themselves.
What is the provision if the office of the State Speaker or the Deputy State Speaker falls vacant?
The members of the State Assembly shall fill the vacancy through election to the State Speaker or the Deputy State Speaker from amongst themselves.

Can the State Speaker and the Deputy State Speaker of the State Assembly be from the same party if there is no representation of more than one party in the State Assembly or no candidacy is filed by more than one party despite representation?

Yes, the members of the same party can be the State Speaker and the Deputy State Speaker of the State Assembly if there is no representation of more than one party in the State Assembly or no candidacy is filed by more than one party despite representation.
Who chairs the State Assembly in the absence of the State Speaker?
The Deputy State Speaker
What happens if the election to the State Speaker and the Deputy State Speaker has not taken place or both positions have become vacant?
The attending member who is by age the senior -most shall chair the meeting of the State Assembly.
Under what circumstances does the office of the State Speaker or the Deputy State Speaker of the State Assembly become vacant?

The office of the State Speaker or the Deputy State Speaker of the State Assembly becomes vacant if he or she ceases to be a member of the State Assembly, Provided that, in the event of the dissolution of the State Assembly, the State Speaker and the Deputy State Speaker of the State Assembly holding their respective offices shall continue in office until the previous day of the filing of nominations for another election to the State Assembly.
What happens to the State Speaker and the Deputy State Speaker of the State Assembly when the State Assembly is dissolved?

The State Speaker and the Deputy State Speaker of the State Assembly holding their respective offices shall continue in office until the previous day of the filing of nominations for another election to the State Assembly.
What is the role of the Deputy State Speaker in the event of the dissolution of the State Assembly?

The State Speaker and the Deputy State Speaker of the State Assembly holding their respective offices shall continue in office until the previous day of the filing of nominations for another election to the State Assembly.
What is the previous day of the filing of nominations for another election to the State Assembly?
the previous day of the filing of nominations for another election to the State Assembly,
What happens if a person resigns after the filing of nominations for another election to the State Assembly?
The text does not provide information about what happens if a person resigns after the filing of nominations for another election to the State Assembly.
What is the condition for resigning in writing?
if he or she resigns in writing,
What is the process for passing a resolution to remove the Speaker of the State Assembly?
A resolution can be passed by a majority of two-thirds of the total number of members of the State Assembly to the effect that his or her conduct is not compatible with his or her office.
Who presides over a meeting to deliberate on a motion that the conduct of the Speaker of the State Assembly is not compatible with his or her office?
The State Deputy Speaker presides over the meeting.
Is the Speaker of the State Assembly entitled to take part and vote in the deliberations on a motion that his or her conduct is not compatible with his or her office?
Yes, the Speaker of the State Assembly is entitled to take part and vote in the deliberations.
What is the role of the State Deputy Speaker in the process of removing the Speaker of the State Assembly?
The State Deputy Speaker presides over a meeting at which deliberations are to be held on a motion that the conduct of the Speaker of the State Assembly is not compatible with his or her office.
What is the minimum number of votes required to pass a resolution to remove the Speaker of the State Assembly?
A resolution can be passed by a majority of two-thirds of the total number of members of the State Assembly.
Who summons a session of the State Assembly within twenty days of the declaration of final results of the election to the State Assembly?
The Chief of State
What is the maximum interval between two consecutive sessions of the State Assembly?
Six months
Can the Chief of State prorogue the sessions of the State Assembly?
Yes

What happens if one-fourth of the total number of members of the State Assembly make a petition that it is expedient to convene a session or meeting during the prorogation or recess of the session of the State Assembly?
The Chief of State shall specify the date and time for such session or meeting
What happens if the Chief of State does not specify the date and time for such session or meeting as requested by one-fourth of the total number of members of the State Assembly?
Not specified in the text
What is the process for the State Assembly to meet or commence its session?
The State Assembly shall meet or commence its session at the date and time so specified.
Who can address a sitting of the State Assembly?
The Chief of State may address a sitting of the State Assembly.
How can the Chief of State summon the members for a purpose?
The Chief of State may summon the members for that purpose by addressing a sitting of the State Assembly.
When does the Chief of State address the first session after an election to the State Assembly?
The Chief of State shall address the first session after an election to the State Assembly.
When does the Chief of State address a sitting of the State Assembly after the commencement of the first session of each year?
The Chief of State shall address a sitting of the State Assembly after the commencement of the first session of each year.
What is the quorum of the State Assembly?
Except as otherwise provided for in this Constitution, no question or motion shall be presented for decision in the State Assembly unless one-fourth of the total number of its members are present.
How are questions submitted for decision in the State Assembly decided?

All questions submitted for decision in the State Assembly shall be decided by a majority vote of the members present and participate in voting. The member chairing the meeting shall not have the right to vote. Provided that he or she may exercise his or her casting vote in the case of a tie.
What is the voting rule for the member chairing the meeting in the State Assembly?
The member chairing the meeting shall not have the right to vote. Provided that he or she may exercise his or her casting vote in the case of a tie.
What is the voting rule for a tie in the State Assembly?
The member chairing the meeting shall not have the right to vote. Provided that he or she may exercise his or her casting vote in the case of a tie.
What is the voting rule for a member in the State Assembly?
All questions submitted for decision in the State Assembly shall be decided by a majority vote of the members present and participate in voting.
What is the full freedom of speech in the State Assembly subject to?
This Constitution
Who shall not be arrested, detained or prosecuted in any court for anything expressed or any vote cast by them in the State Assembly?
No member
What is the full power of the State Assembly to regulate and decide its internal business?
The State Assembly shall, subject to this Constitution, have full power to regulate and decide its internal business
What is the exclusive right of the State Assembly?
It shall be the exclusive right of the State Assembly to decide whether or not any of its proceedings is regular or irregular
What shall not be raised in any court in this behalf?
No question shall be raised in any court in this behalf
What shall not be made about the good faith concerning any proceeding of the State Assembly?
No comment shall be made about the good faith concerning any proceeding of the State Assembly
What shall not be intentionally distorted about anything said by any member in the State Assembly?
No publication and broadcasting of any kind shall be made about anything said by any member, intentionally distorting
What is not allowed in the context of anything said by any member?
distorting or misinterpreting the meaning of the speech
Who are the provisions of clauses (1) and (3) applicable to?
other persons who are entitled to participate in the meetings of the State Assembly than the members of State Assembly
What kind of proceedings are not allowed to be initiated in any court against any person?
proceedings in any court against any person in respect of the publication, under the authority granted by the State Assembly, of any document, report, vote or proceeding
What is the rule regarding the initiation of court proceedings against persons who are not members of the State Assembly?
No proceedings shall be initiated in any court against any person in respect of the publication, under the authority granted by the State Assembly, of any document, report, vote or proceeding
What is the rule regarding the misuse of speech by members in the State Assembly?
The provisions of clauses (1) and (3) shall apply to such misuse
What does 'State Assembly' mean according to the text?
For the purposes of this clause and clauses (1), (2), (3) and (4), 'State Assembly' means and includes the meeting of a committee of the State Assembly.
What is the period during which a member of the State Assembly cannot be arrested?
The period from the issuance of a notice summoning the session to its prorogation.
What is the provision regarding the arrest of a member on a criminal charge?
Nothing in this clause shall be deemed to prevent the arrest under the law of any member on a criminal charge.
What happens if any information about the arrest of a member is not given to the person presiding over the State Assembly?
If any member is so arrested, the authority making such arrest shall forthwith give information thereof to the person presiding over the State Assembly.
What is the consequence of breaching the privileges of the State Assembly?
Any breach of the privileges shall be deemed to constitute contempt of the State Assembly.
Who has the exclusive right to decide whether any breach of the privileges of the State Assembly has taken place?
The State Assembly shall have the exclusive right to decide whether any breach of its privileges has taken place.
What is the consequence of being in contempt of the State Assembly?
If any person is in contempt of the State Assembly, the person shall be deemed to have committed contempt of the State Assembly.
What action may the presiding over the State Assembly take after a decision by the State Assembly?
after a decision by the State Assembly, admonish, warn or impose a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding three months or of a fine not exceeding ten thousand rupees on such person
What is the maximum term of imprisonment that can be imposed by the presiding over the State Assembly?
three months
What is the maximum fine that can be imposed by the presiding over the State Assembly?
ten thousand rupees
What happens if the person who is admonished, warned or fined submits an apology to the satisfaction of the State Assembly?
it may either pardon him or her or remit or commute the sentence imposed on him or her
How are other matters relating to privileges of the State Assembly handled?
Other matters relating to privileges of the State Assembly shall be as provided in the State law.
What is the action that the Chief Minister may take to show confidence from the State Assembly?
The Chief Minister may table a resolution to show that he or she has confidence from the State Assembly.
What is the purpose of the resolution that the Chief Minister may table?
The purpose of the resolution is to show that the Chief Minister has confidence from the State Assembly.
Under what circumstances can the Chief Minister table a resolution for a vote of confidence?
The Chief Minister may table a resolution for a vote of confidence whenever he or she considers necessary or appropriate.
Where should the Chief Minister table the resolution for a vote of confidence?
The Chief Minister should table the resolution for a vote of confidence in the State Assembly.
What is the effect of the resolution for a vote of confidence?
The effect of the resolution for a vote of confidence is to show that the Chief Minister has confidence from the State Assembly.
What happens if the political party which the Chief Minister represents is divided or a political party in coalition State Government withdraws its support?
The Chief Minister shall table a resolution in the State Assembly for a vote of confidence within thirty days.
What is the consequence if a resolution tabled under clauses (1) and (2) is not passed by a majority of the total number of then members of the State Assembly?
The Chief Minister shall relieve of his or her office.
How many members of the State Assembly can table a motion of no confidence against the Chief Minister?
One-fourth of the total number of then members of the State Assembly.
When can a motion of no confidence against the Chief Minister be tabled?
Not until the first two years after the appointment of the Chief Minister and until another one.
What happens if the Chief Minister does not table a resolution for a vote of confidence within thirty days as per clause (2)?
The consequences are not specified in the text.
What is the duration for the Chief Minister's term after the appointment?
two years after the appointment
What should a motion of no confidence tabled under clause (4) indicate?
the name of a member proposed for Chief Minister
What happens if a motion of no confidence tabled under clause (4) is passed by a majority of the total number of then members of the State Assembly?
the Chief Minister shall relieve of his or her office
Who appoints as the Chief Minister if the office of the Chief Minister falls vacant because of the passage of a vote of no-confidence under clause (6)?
the Chief of State

What article should be referred to in accordance with the appointment of the Chief Minister when the office of the Chief Minister falls vacant because of the passage of a vote of no-confidence under clause (6)?
Article 168
Who is entitled to attend and take part in the proceedings and deliberations of the State Assembly or its committees?
The Minister, Minister of State and Assistant Minister
What is the title of the person who is entitled to attend and take part in the proceedings and deliberations of the State Assembly or its committees?
The Minister, Minister of State and Assistant Minister
What is the entitlement of the Minister, Minister of State and Assistant Minister in the State Assembly or its committees?
The Minister, Minister of State and Assistant Minister shall be entitled to attend, and take part in the proceedings and deliberations of, the State Assembly or its committees.
What are the proceedings and deliberations that the Minister, Minister of State and Assistant Minister can attend and take part in?
The Minister, Minister of State and Assistant Minister shall be entitled to attend, and take part in the proceedings and deliberations of, the State Assembly or its committees.
What is the role of the Minister, Minister of State and Assistant Minister in the State Assembly or its committees?
The Minister, Minister of State and Assistant Minister shall be entitled to attend, and take part in the proceedings and deliberations of, the State Assembly or its committees.
Who is not entitled to vote in a meeting of the State Assembly or its committee?
A Minister, Minister of State or Assistant Minister who is not a member of the State Assembly
Who is not entitled to vote in a meeting of a committee of which he or she is not a member?
A Minister, Minister of State or Assistant Minister

What is the penalty for a person who has not taken oath under Article 179 or who is not a member of the State Assembly and is present or votes in a meeting of the State Assembly or of its committee as a member?
The person shall, by order of the person chairing the meeting, be fined with a sum of five thousand rupees for each instance of such

What is the penalty for a person who has not taken oath under Article 179 or who is not a member of the State Assembly and is present or votes in a meeting of a committee of which he or she is not a member as a member?
Not specified in the text

What is the penalty for a person who has not taken oath under Article 179 or who is not a member of the State Assembly and is present or votes in a meeting of the State Assembly or of its committee as a member, according to the text?
The person shall, by order of the person chairing the meeting, be fined with a sum of five thousand rupees for each instance of such
What is the fine for each instance of unauthorized presence or voting in the State Assembly?
a sum of five thousand rupees
What is the restriction on discussion in the State Assembly?

No discussion shall be held in the State Assembly on any matters that may cause adverse effect on the dispensation of justice on any cases which are sub judice in any courts of Nepal and on any judicial acts done by Judges in the course of performance of their duties.
What is the power of the State Assembly in case of a vacancy in the seat of its member?

The State Assembly shall have the power to transact its business notwithstanding any vacancy in the seat of its member; and no proceedings of the State Assembly already conducted shall become invalid even if it is subsequently discovered that a person who was not so entitled took part in such proceedings.
What is the recovery of the fine mentioned in the text?
as a government due
What is the restriction on discussion in the State Assembly regarding cases?

No discussion shall be held in the State Assembly on any matters that may cause adverse effect on the dispensation of justice on any cases which are sub judice in any courts of Nepal and on any judicial acts done by Judges in the course of performance of their duties.
What can the State Assembly do in accordance with its rules?
The State Assembly may, in accordance with its rules, form committees or special committees, as required, in order to manage its working procedures.
What rules does the State Assembly have to frame?

The State Assembly shall frame rules to conduct its business, maintain order during its meetings and regulate the constitution, functions and procedures of, and other matters relating to, its committees.
What happens until such rules are framed?
Until such rules are framed, the State Assembly shall regulate its procedures on its own.
What is the power of the State Assembly to form committees?
The State Assembly may, in accordance with its rules, form committees or special committees, as required, in order to manage its working procedures.
What does the State Assembly do to manage its working procedures?
The State Assembly may, in accordance with its rules, form committees or special committees, as required, in order to manage its working procedures.
Who is appointed as the Secretary of the State Assembly?
The Chief of State shall appoint the Secretary of the State Assembly on recommendation of the Speaker of State Assembly.
What is the role of the Secretariat in the State Assembly?
There shall be a Secretariat for conducting and managing the business of the State Assembly.
What is the process for establishing the Secretariat and other matters related thereto?
The establishment of such Secretariat and other matters related thereto shall be as provided for in the State law.
What are the qualifications, functions, duties, powers, and other conditions of service of the Secretary of the State Assembly?
The qualification, functions, duties, powers and other conditions of service of the Secretary of the State Assembly shall be as provided for in the State law.
How is the remuneration and facilities of the Speaker and the Deputy Speaker of the State Assembly determined?
The remuneration and facilities of the Speaker and the Deputy Speaker of the State Assembly shall be as provided for in the State law, and as specified by the State Government until such law is made.
What are the legislative powers of the State Assembly?
The legislative powers of the State Assembly shall be as contained in lists of Schedule -6, Schedule-7 and Schedule-9.
What is the title of the section discussing the legislative powers of the State Assembly?
Part-15  State Legislative Procedures
What is money or the giving of guarantee by the State Government?
money or the giving of guarantee by the State Government
What pertains to the amendment of the law with respect to any financial obligations undertaken or to be undertaken by the State Government?
any matter pertaining to the amendment of the law with respect to any financial obligations undertaken or to be undertaken by the State Government
What is the subject of (d) in the text?
the custody and investment of all revenues received by any State Government Fund, moneys acquired through the
What are the subjects that a Bill can be related to according to the Constitution of a State?

The subjects that a Bill can be related to according to the Constitution of a State are repayment of loans, grants, audits of the accounts of the State Government, and incidental matters directly related to any of the subjects specified in clause (a), (b), (c) or (d).
What is the provision for a Bill that provides for the levying of charges or fees such as license fee, application fee, renewal fee or for the imposition of fines or penalty of imprisonment?

A Bill that provides for the levying of charges or fees such as license fee, application fee, renewal fee or for the imposition of fines or penalty of imprisonment is not deemed to be a Money Bill by the reason only that it provides for the levying of any charges or fees.
Who has the final decision on whether a Bill is a Money Bill or not?
The Speaker of the State Assembly has the final decision on whether a Bill is a Money Bill or not.
What happens to a Bill passed by the State Assembly if a session terminates while it is under consideration?
If a session of the State Assembly terminates while a Bill is under consideration, deliberations on the Bill may continue at the succeeding session.
What is the procedure for a Bill to be presented to the Chief of State for assent?
A Bill passed by the State Assembly shall be presented to the Chief of State for assent.
What happens if the State Assembly is dissolved or its term expires when a Bill is under its consideration?
Such a Bill shall lapse.
What is the process for withdrawing a Bill?
A member who has introduced a Bill may, with the approval of the State Assembly, withdraw the Bill.
What happens to a Bill if the State Assembly is dissolved or its term expires and it is not under consideration?
The Bill shall not lapse.
Can a Bill be withdrawn without the approval of the State Assembly?
No, a member can withdraw a Bill only with the approval of the State Assembly.
What is the fate of a Bill if the State Assembly is dissolved or its term expires and it is under consideration?
Such a Bill shall lapse.
Who presents a Bill to the Chief of State for assent under Article 199?
The Speaker of State Assembly
What is the role of the Speaker of State Assembly in the case of a Money Bill?
The Speaker of State Assembly shall certify
What is the provision for presenting a Bill to the Chief of State for assent in the case of a Money Bill?
In the case of a Money Bill, the Speaker of State Assembly shall so certify
What is the role of the Speaker of State Assembly in certifying a Bill?
The Speaker of State Assembly shall certify the Bill
What is the role of the Speaker of State Assembly in the case of a non-Money Bill?
A Bill which is to be presented to the Chief of State for assent under Article 199 shall be so presented by the Speaker of State Assembly after it has been certified by him or her
What is the time limit for the Chief of State to assent to a Bill?
A Bill presented to the Chief of State for his or her assent shall be assented to within fifteen days.
What happens if the Chief of State is of the opinion that any Bill needs further deliberations?

If the Chief of State is of the opinion that any Bill needs further deliberations, he or she may send back the Bill with his or her message to the State Assembly within fifteen days from the date of presentation of the Bill to him or her.
What happens if a Bill is sent back with a message by the Chief of State under clause (3)?

If any Bill is sent back with his or her message by the Chief of State under clause (3), it shall be reconsidered by the State Assembly and if the Bill so reconsidered is again passed as it was or with amendments, and is again presented to him or her, the Chief of State shall give assent to that Bill within fifteen days of such presentation.
What is the final step for a Bill to become an Act?
A Bill shall become an Act after the Chief of State gives assent to it.
What is the exception for a Money Bill in the process of becoming an Act?

Except for a Money Bill, if the Chief of State is of the opinion that any Bill needs further deliberations, he or she may send back the Bill with his or her message to the State Assembly within fifteen days from the date of presentation of the Bill to him or her.
What is the first clause of the Ordinance?

If, at any time, except when the State Assembly is in session, a circumstance exists which render s it necessary to take immediate action, the Chief of State may, on the recommendation of the State Council of Ministers, promulgate an Ordinance.
What is the force and effect of an Ordinance promulgated under clause (1)?
An Ordinance promulgated under clause (1) shall have the same force and effect as an Act.
What happens to an Ordinance if it is not passed by the State Assembly?
If not passed by the State Assembly, it shall ipso facto cease to be effective.
What can be done to repeal an Ordinance?
An Ordinance may be repealed at any time by the Chief of State.
What happens to an Ordinance if it is not tabled at the session of the State Assembly held after the promulgation?
If not tabled at the session of the State Assembly held after the promulgation, it shall ipso facto cease to be effective.
What happens to an Ordinance if it is not rendered ineffective or repealed under sub-clause (a) or (b), and a meeting of the State Assembly is held?

Unless rendered ineffective or repealed under sub - clause (a) or (b), it shall ipso facto cease to be effective at the expiration of sixty days after the day on which a meeting of the State Assembly is held.
What is stated about levying taxes in a State according to law?
No tax shall be levied and collected in a State except in accordance with law.
What is the condition for raising a loan and giving a guarantee by the State Government?
No loan shall be raised and guarantee given by the State Government except as provided for in the Federal law.
What is the name of the fund where all revenues received by the State Government are credited, except for the revenues of trusts (Guthi)?
State Consolidated Fund
What are the conditions for incurring expenditure out of the State Consolidated Fund or any other State Government Fund?

Expenditure can be incurred out of the State Consolidated Fund or any other State Government Fund only if it is moneys charged on the State Consolidated Fund, moneys required to meet the expenditure under an Appropriation Act, or advance moneys authorized by an Act required to meet
What are the types of moneys that can be credited to the State Consolidated Fund?

All revenues received by the State Government, all loans raised on the security of revenues, all moneys received in repayment of any loans made under the authority of any State Act and any mounts of grants or loans received from the Government of Nepal
What are the types of expenditures that can be made from the State Consolidated Fund or any other State Government Fund?

Expenditure can be made from the State Consolidated Fund or any other State Government Fund for moneys charged on the State Consolidated Fund, moneys required to meet the expenditure under an Appropriation Act, or advance moneys authorized by an Act required to meet
What are the types of moneys that can be incurred as expenditure out of the State Consolidated Fund or any other State Government Fund?
Moneys charged on the State Consolidated Fund, moneys required to meet the expenditure under an Appropriation Act, and advance moneys authorized by an Act required to meet
What are the four actions that can be taken by the President under the Act?

The President can (a) advance moneys authorized by a n Act required to meet expenditures, when an Appropriation Bill is under consideration, (b) advance moneys authorized by a n Act required to meet expenditures, when an Appropriation Bill is not under consideration, (c) advance moneys for expenditures to be incurred in extraordin ary circumstances under a V ote of Credit Act which contains only a description of expenditures, or (d) expenditures to be incurred in extraordin ary circumstances under a V ote of Credit Act which contains only a description of expenditures.
What is the provision for matters relating to the State Contingency Fund?
Matters relating to the State Contingency Fund shall be in accordance with Article 212.
What is the purpose of advancing moneys authorized by a n Act required to meet expenditures, when an Appropriation Bill is under consideration?
The purpose of advancing moneys authorized by a n Act required to meet expenditures, when an Appropriation Bill is under consideration, is to meet expenditures.
What is the purpose of advancing moneys authorized by a n Act required to meet expenditures, when an Appropriation Bill is not under consideration?
The purpose of advancing moneys authorized by a n Act required to meet expenditures, when an Appropriation Bill is not under consideration, is not specified in the text.
What is the purpose of the Vote of Credit Act that contains only a description of expenditures?
The purpose of the Vote of Credit Act that contains only a description of expenditures is to allow for expenditures to be incurred in extraordin ary circumstances.
What expenditures are chargeable on the State Consolidated Fund without the approval of the State Assembly?

The expenditures relating to the following matters shall be charged on the State Consolidated Fund: (a) the amount required as remuneration and facilities payable to the State Speaker and the State Deputy Speaker, (b) the amount required as remuneration and facilities payable to the Chairperson and members of the State Public Service Commission, (c) all charges relating to debts for which the State Government is liable, (d) any sum required to satisfy any judgment or decree made by a court against the State Government, and (e) any other sum specified by a State law to be chargeable on the State Consolidated Fund.
What is the remuneration and facilities payable to the State Speaker and the State Deputy Speaker?
The amount required as remuneration and facilities payable to the State Speaker and the State Deputy Speaker.
What is the remuneration and facilities payable to the Chairperson and members of the State Public Service Commission?
The amount required as remuneration and facilities payable to the Chairperson and members of the State Public Service Commission.
What charges are related to debts for which the State Government is liable?
All charges relating to debts for which the State Government is liable.
What sum is required to satisfy any judgment or decree made by a court against the State Government?
Any sum required to satisfy any judgment or decree made by a court against the State Government.
What should the State Minister for Finance lay before the State Assembly in respect of every financial year?

The State Minister for Finance shall, in respect of every financial year, lay before the State Assembly an annual estimate setting out, inter alia, the following matters: (a) an estimate of revenues, (b) the moneys required to meet the charges on the State Consolidated Fund, and (c) the moneys required to meet the expenditure to be provided for by a State Appropriation Act.
What should be included in the annual estimate laid by the State Minister for Finance?

The annual estimate to be laid pursuant to clause (1) shall also be accompanied by a statement of the expenses allocated to every Ministry in the previous financial year and particulars of whether the objectives of the expenses have been achieved.
What are the three matters that the annual estimate set out by the State Minister for Finance should include?

The annual estimate set out by the State Minister for Finance should include an estimate of revenues, the moneys required to meet the charges on the State Consolidated Fund, and the moneys required to meet the expenditure to be provided for by a State Appropriation Act.
What should be included in the statement that accompanies the annual estimate?

The statement that accompanies the annual estimate should include a statement of the expenses allocated to every Ministry in the previous financial year and particulars of whether the objectives of the expenses have been achieved.
What is the purpose of the statement of expenses allocated to every Ministry in the previous financial year?
The purpose of the statement of expenses allocated to every Ministry in the previous financial year is to provide particulars of whether the objectives of the expenses have been achieved.
What is the title of the section that describes the State Appropriation Act?
208. State Appropriation Act
What is the process for laying a supplementary estimate before the State Assembly?

The State Minister for Finance may lay before the State Assembly a supplementary estimate if it is found in any financial year,- (1) that the sum authorized to be spent for a particular service by the State Appropriation Act for the current financial year is insufficient, or that a need has arisen for expenditures upon some new service not provided for in the State Appropriation Act for that year, or (b) that the expenditures made during that financial year are in excess of the amount authorized by the State Appropriation Act.
What is the title of the subsection that describes the conditions for laying a supplementary estimate?
What are the conditions for laying a supplementary estimate under subsection (1) of the section that describes the conditions for laying a supplementary estimate?

(a) that the sum authorized to be spent for a particular service by the State Appropriation Act for the current financial year is insufficient, or that a need has arisen for expenditures upon some new service not provided for in the State Appropriation Act for that year, or (b) that the expenditures made during that financial year are in excess of the amount authorized by the State Appropriation Act.
What is the title of the subsection that describes the effect of the supplementary estimates?
What is specified under the heads in a Supplementary Appropriation Bill?
Not specified
What is not allowed in a Vote on Account Bill?
The sums involved in the Vote on Account shall not exceed one-third of the estimate of expenditures for the financial year.
When can a portion of the expenditure estimated for the financial year be incurred in advance?
A portion of the expenditure estimated for the financial year may, when a State Appropriation Bill is under consideration, be incurred in advance under a State Act.
What should be done before a Vote on Account Bill is introduced?
The estimates of revenues and expenditures have been laid in accordance with Article 207.
Where should the expenditures incurred in accordance with the State Vote on Account Act be included?
The expenditures incurred in accordance with the State Vote on Account Act shall be included in the State Appropriation Bill.
What is the title of the section that discusses Vote of Credit?
211. V otes of Credit:
What is the reason for the Vote of Credit provision in the text?
owing to an emergency due to natural causes or other reasons
What is the body that may lay a Vote of Credit Bill according to the text?
The State Minister for Finance
What is the title of the section that discusses the State Contingency Fund?
212. State Contingency Fund:
What is the name of the fund created by a State Act according to the text?
The State Contingency Fund
What can be used to meet unforeseen expenditure?
The unforeseen expenditure may be met out of such Fund by the State Government.
Who is responsible for reimbursing the amount of the expenditure under clause (2)?
The amount of the expenditure under clause (2) shall be reimbursed as soon as possible by the State Act.
What is the Act relating to financial procedures?
The Act relating to financial procedures is as provided for in the State Act.
What matters relate to the transfer of moneys appropriated by the State Act?
Matters relating to the transfer of moneys appropriated by the State Act from one head to another and other financial procedures shall be as provided for in the State Act.
What is vested in the Village Executive or the Municipal Executive according to the Constitution?
The executive power of the Local Level, pursuant to this Constitution and the Federal law.
Where can the local executive power be found?
The local executive power can be found in Schedule -8 and Schedule-9.
Who is responsible for issuing general directives, controlling, and regulating the governance of the Village Body and the Municipality?
The responsibility for issuing general directives, controlling, and regulating the governance of the Village Body and the Municipality lies in the Village Executive and the Municipal Executive.
Who performs the executive functions of the Village Body and the Municipality?
The executive functions of the Village Body and the Municipality shall be performed in the name of the Village Executive and the Municipal Executive.
What decision or order must be issued in the name of the Village Executive and the Municipal Executive according to the text?
Any decision or order to be issued in the name of the Village Executive and the Municipal Executive pursuant to clause (4) and other.
What are Executive and the Municipal Executive authenticated as?
Executive and the Municipal Executive shall be authenticated as provided for in the Local law.
What is the clause that the Executive and the Municipal Executive are pursuant to?
Executive and the Municipal Executive pursuant to clause (4)
What are the instruments of authorization pertaining to the Executive and the Municipal Executive?
Other instruments of authorization pertaining thereto
What is the title of the section that discusses the authentication of the Executive and the Municipal Executive?
The Local law
What is the clause that allows for other instruments of authorization for the Executive and the Municipal Executive?
other instruments of authorization pertaining thereto
Who is the Chairperson of the Village Executive?
There shall be a Chairperson of Village Executive in each Village Body.
Who forms the Village Executive?
The Village Executive shall be formed under his or her chairpersonship.
What does the Village Executive consist of?
The Village Executive under clause (1) shall consist of one Vice - Chairperson, Ward Chairperson elected from each Ward and members elected pursuant to clause (4).
How are the Chairperson and the Vice-Chairperson elected?

The Chairperson and the Vice-Chairperson shall be elected by the voters residing within the concerned Village Body area by secret ballots on the basis of one person one vote, in accordance with the first past the post electoral system.
What does 'Chairperson' and 'Vice - Chairperson' mean for the purposes of this Article?
For the purposes of this Article, 'Chairperson' and 'Vice - Chairperson' mean the Chairperson and the Vice - Chairperson of the Village Executive.
What is the number of women members elected by the Village Assembly from amongst themselves?
four
What is the number of members elected by the Village Assembly from the Dalit or minority communit ies?
two
What qualification is required to be elected to the office of the Chairperson, Vice -Chairperson, Ward Chairperson and member?
being a citizen of Nepal, having completed the age of twenty one years, being a voter whose name is included in the electo ral rolls of the Village Body, not being disqualified by any law
What is the deadline for electing the members of the Village Executive according to the text?
no later than fifteen days after the final results of the election to the Village Assembly under Article 222
What is the term of office of the Chairperson, Vice -Chairperson, Ward Chairperson and member?
The term is not specified in the text
What is the condition for not being disqualified by any law?
not being disqualified by any law.
What is the term of office of the Chairperson, Vice -Chairperson, Ward Chairperson and member?
The term of office of the Chairperson, Vice -Chairperson, Ward Chairperson and member shall be five years after the date of being elected.
What is the condition for a person who has been elected as the Chairperson for two terms to be eligible to be a candidate in an election to the Village Body?
A person who has been elected as the Chairperson for two terms shall not be eligible to be a candidate in an election to the Village Body.
What is the condition for the office of the Chairperson, Vice -Chairperson, Ward Chairperson or member to become vacant?
The office of the Chairperson, Vice -Chairperson, Ward Chairperson or member shall become vacant in any of the following circumstances:
What is the maximum number of terms a Chairperson can serve?
A person who has been elected as the Chairperson for two terms shall not be eligible to be a candidate in an election to the Village Body.
Who chairs the Municipal Executive?
The Mayor
What is the composition of the Municipal Executive?
The Municipal Executive consists of one Deputy Mayor, Ward Chairperson elected from each Ward, and members elected pursuant to clause (4)
How are the Mayor and Deputy Mayor elected?

The Mayor and the Deputy Mayor are elected by the voters residing within the concerned Municipal area by secret ballots on the basis of one person one vote, in accordance with the first past the post electoral system
What is the purpose of the term 'Mayor' and 'Deputy Mayor' in this Article?
For the purposes of this Article, 'Mayor' and 'Deputy Mayor' mean the Mayor and the Deputy Mayor of the Municipal Executive
How many women members are included in the Municipal Executive?
The Municipal Executive shall also include five women members
Who elects the women members in the Municipal Assembly?
The members of the Municipal Assembly
How are the women members elected?
They are elected amongst themselves
Who are the women members elected from?
From amongst themselves
How many members are elected by the Municipal Assembly from the Dalit or minority communities?
Three
What qualification must the members elected from the Dalit or minority communities possess?
The qualification under clause (5)

How much time does the Municipal Assembly have to elect the women members and the members from the Dalit or minority communities after the final results of the election to the Municipal Assembly under Article 223?
No later than fifteen days
What qualifications are required to be elected to the office of the Mayor, Deputy Mayor, Ward Chairperson and member?

A person who has the following qualification shall be qualified to be elected to the office of the Mayor, Deputy Mayor, Ward Chairperson and member: (a) being a citizen of Nepal, (b) having completed the age of twenty one years, (c) being a voter whose name is included in the electoral rolls of the Municipality, (d) not being disqualified by any law.
What is the term of office of the Mayor, Deputy Mayor, Ward Chairperson and member?
The term of office of the Mayor, Deputy Mayor, Ward Chairperson and member shall be five years after the date of being elected.
Can a person who has been elected as the Mayor for two terms be a candidate in an election to the Municipality?
A person who has been elected as the Mayor for two terms shall not be eligible to be a candidate in an election to the Municipality.
What circumstances cause the office of the Mayor, Deputy Mayor, Ward Chairperson or Member to become vacant?

The office of the Mayor, Deputy Mayor, Ward Chairperson or Member shall become vacant in any of the following circumstances: (a) if the Mayor tenders resignation in writing to the Deputy Mayor, and if the Deputy Mayor tenders resignation in writing to the Speaker.
What is the maximum number of terms a person can serve as the Mayor?
A person who has been elected as the Mayor for two terms shall not be eligible to be a candidate in an election to the Municipality.
What are the conditions for a vacancy in the seat of the Deputy Mayor?

The Deputy Mayor's seat can vacate under the following conditions: (a) if the Deputy Mayor tenders resignation in writing before the Mayor, (b) if his or her term of office expires, (c) if he or she dies.
What happens if the seat of the Deputy Mayor becomes vacant while the term of office of the Mayor or Deputy Mayor still remains for more than one year?

If the seat falls vacant under clause (8) while the term of office of the Mayor or Deputy Mayor still remains for more than one year, the vacancy shall be filled through by-election for the remainder of term.
What is the process for filling a vacancy in the seat of the Mayor or Deputy Mayor?

If the seat falls vacant under clause (8) while the term of office of the Mayor or Deputy Mayor still remains for more than one year, the vacancy shall be filled through by-election for the remainder of term.
What is the duration of the term of office of the Mayor or Deputy Mayor?
Not specified in the text.
What is the duration of the by-election for filling a vacancy in the seat of the Mayor or Deputy Mayor?
Not specified in the text.
Who coordinates the judicial committee in the case of a Village Body?
The Vice-Chairperson
Who coordinates the judicial committee in the case of a Municipality?
The Deputy Mayor
How many members does the judicial committee consist of?
Two
Who elects the members of the judicial committee from amongst themselves in a Village?
The members of the Village Assembly
Who elects the members of the judicial committee from amongst themselves in a Municipality?
The members of the Municipal Assembly
What provisions relate to the Local Level Executive, except those contained in this Part?
Other provisions relating to the Local Level Executive, except those contained in this Part, shall be as provided for in the Federal law, subject to this Constitution.
What is the purpose of the District Assembly?
There shall be a District Assembly to make coordination between the Village Bodies and Municipalities within the district.
Who are the members of the District Assembly?
The District Assembly shall consist of Chairpersons and Vice - Chairpersons of Village Executives, and Mayors and Deputy Mayors of Municipal Executives within the district.
When is the first meeting of the District Assembly to be held?
The first meeting of the District Assembly shall be held no later than thirty days of the date of final results of the election to the Village Assemblies and the Municipal Assemblies.
What is the role of the District Coordination Committee?
The District Assembly shall elect the District Coordination Committee.
What is the maximum number of Members in the Committee?
nine
What is the position of the Chief in the Committee?
Chief
What is the position of the Deputy Chief in the Committee?
Deputy Chief
What is the minimum number of women in the Committee?
three
What is the minimum requirement for Dalit or minority in the Committee?
one
What is the role of the District Coordination Committee?
The District Coordination Committee shall discharge all functions required to be discharged by the District Assembly.
Who is eligible to be a candidate for the office of Chief, Deputy Chief or Member of the District Coordination Committee?
A Member of a Village Assembly or Municipal Assembly within the concerned district
What happens to the Committee's office when his or her term as Member of Village Assembly or Municipal Assembly expires?
The term of office of the Committee lapses.
What is the term of office of the Chief, Deputy Chief and member of the District Coordination Committee?
The term of office of the Chief, Deputy Chief and member of the District Coordination Committee is five years after the date of being elected.
In what circumstances does the office of the Chief, Deputy Chief and member of the District Coordination Committee become vacant?

The office of the Chief, Deputy Chief and member of the District Coordination Committee becomes vacant in any of the following circumstances: (a) if the Chief tenders resignation in writing before the Deputy Chief, and if the Deputy Chief or member tenders resignation in writing before the Chief, (b) if his or her term of office expires, (c) if he or she dies.
What are the functions, duties and powers of the District Assembly?

The functions, duties and powers of the District Assembly are as follows: (a) to make coordination between the Village Bodies and Municipalities within the district, (b) to monitor development and construction works to make balance.
What is the purpose of the District Assembly in terms of coordination between Village Bodies and Municipalities within the district?

The purpose of the District Assembly in terms of coordination between Village Bodies and Municipalities within the district is to make coordination between the Village Bodies and Municipalities within the district.
What are the municipalities within the district responsible for?

Municipalities within the district are responsible for (a) to monitor development and construction works to make balance of such works, (b) to monitor development and construction works to make balance of such works.
What is the second responsibility of municipalities within the district?
The second responsibility of municipalities within the district is to monitor development and construction works to make balance of such works.
What is the third responsibility of municipalities within the district?
The third responsibility of municipalities within the district is to make coordination between the Federal and the State Government offices and Village Bodies and Municipalities in the district.
What is the fourth responsibility of municipalities within the district?
The fourth responsibility of municipalities within the district is to perform other functions as provided for in the State law.
What provisions relate to the conduct of the District Assembly?
Provisions relating to the conduct of the District Assembly shall be as provided for in the State law.
What are the legislative powers of the Local Level?
The legislative powers of the Local Level shall be vested in the Village Assembly and the Municipal Assembly, subject to this Constitution.
What are the legislative powers of the Village Assembly and the Municipal Assembly?
The legislative powers of the Village Assembly and the Municipal Assembly shall be as mention ed in the lists contained in Schedule -8 and Schedule-9.
What is the composition of a Village Assembly?

A Village Assembly consists of the Chairperson and Vice -Chairperson of the Village Executive, Ward Chairpersons, and four members elected from each ward and Members of the Village Executive elected from Dalit and minority communities pursuant to clause (4) of Article 215.
What is the minimum representation of women in a Village Assembly?
A Village Assembly to be formed under clause (1) shall have representation of at least two women from each ward.
How are Ward Chairpersons and Ward members elected?
Such Ward Chairperson and Ward members shall be elected in accordance with the first past the post electoral system.
What is the composition of a Ward Committee?
Each ward of a Village Body under the Federal law shall have a Ward Committee composed of the Ward Chairperson and four members.
What is the minimum age requirement for a person to be a part of the Village Assembly?
Every person who has completed the age of eighteen years and
Who has the right to vote in the first past the post electoral system?
Every person who has completed the age of eighteen years and whose name is included in the electoral rolls of the Village Body
What is the qualification to become a candidate for the office of the Member of the Village Assembly?
A person who has the following qualification shall be qualified to become a candidate for the office of the Member of the Village Assembly
What is the age requirement to vote in the first past the post electoral system?
Every person who has completed the age of eighteen years
What is the source of the voting rights in the first past the post electoral system?
The right to vote as provided for in the Federal law
Who is eligible to vote in the first past the post electoral system according to the text?
Every person who has completed the age of eighteen years and whose name is included in the electoral rolls of the Village Body and whose name is included in the electo ral rolls of the Vil lage Body
What are the conditions to be a member of the Village Assembly in Nepal?
being a citizen of Nepal, having completed the age of twenty one years, being his or her name included in the electoral rolls of the Village Body, and not being disqualified by any law.
What is the age requirement to be a member of the Village Assembly in Nepal?
having completed the age of twenty one years
What is the requirement for a person's name to be included in the electoral rolls of the Village Body?
being his or her name included in the electoral rolls of the Village Body
What law determines the matters relating to the election to the Village Assembly in Nepal?
Matters relating to the election to the Village Assembly and other matters pertaining thereto shall be as provided for in the Federal law.
What disqualifies a person from being a member of the Village Assembly in Nepal?
not being disqualified by any law.
What is each Municipality required to have?
Each Municipality shall have a Municipal Assembly.
What does a Municipal Assembly consist of?

A Municipal Assembly under clause (1) shall consist of the Mayor and the Deputy Mayor of the Municipal Executive, Ward Chairpersons, and four members elected from each Ward and members of the Municipal Executive elected from Dalit or minority communities pursuant to clause (4) of Article 216. A Municipal Assembly to be formed under clause (1) shall have representation of at least two women from each Ward.
What is the composition of a Ward Committee?

Each ward of a Municipality shall have a Ward Committee composed of one Ward Chairperson and four members as provided for in the Federal law. Such Ward Chair person and Ward members shall be elected in accordance with the first past the post electoral system.
What is the minimum age to be eligible for election in a Municipality?
Every person who has completed the age of eighteen years and
What is the electoral system used for electing Ward Chairpersons and Ward members?
Such Ward Chair person and Ward members shall be elected in accordance with the first past the post electoral system.
Who has the right to vote in the Municipality as provided for in the Federal law?
whose name is included in the electoral rolls of the Municipality
What qualification is required to be a candidate for the office of member of the Municipal Assembly?
being a citizen of Nepal
What is the qualification (a) for being a candidate for the office of member of the Municipal Assembly?
being a citizen of Nepal
What is the condition (b) for being eligible to vote in the Municipal Assembly?
having completed the age of twenty one years
What is the condition (c) for being eligible to vote in the Municipal Assembly?
being his or her name included in the electoral rolls of the Municipality
What is the condition (d) for being eligible to vote in the Municipal Assembly?
not being disqualified by any law
What matters are governed by the Federal law in relation to the election to the Municipal Assembly?
Matters relating to the election to the Municipal Assembly and other matters pertaining thereto
Who is the Chairperson of a Village Assembly?
The Chairperson of a Village Assembly is ipso facto the Chairperson of the Village Executive.
Who is the Vice-Chairperson of a Municipal Assembly?
The Vice-Chairperson of a Municipal Assembly is ipso facto the Vice-Chairperson of the Municipal Executive.
What is the term of a Village Assembly and Municipal Assembly?
The term of a Village Assembly and of a Municipal Assembly is five years for the date of election.
What happens when the term of a Village Assembly or Municipal Assembly expires?
Another Village Assembly and Municipal Assembly shall be elected not later than six months of the expiration of such a term.
What matters can a Village Assembly and a Municipal Assembly make laws on?
A Village Assembly and a Municipal Assembly may make necessary laws on the matters set forth in the Lists contained in Schedule-8 and Schedule-9.
What is the process for making laws under clause (1) as per the text?
The process for making laws under clause (1) shall be as provided for in the State Law.
What are the other provisions relating to the Village Assembly and Municipal Assembly as per the text?

Other matters relating to the conduct of business of a Village Assembly and Municipal Assembly, rules of procedures of meetings, formation of committees, conditions in which the office of member falls vacant, facilities receivable by members of the Village Assembly and Municipal Assembly and employees and offices of the Village Body and Municipality shall be as provided for in the State law.
What is not allowed to be levied or raised in the Local level according to the law?
No tax shall be levied and collected and no loan raised in the Local level except in accordance with law.
What are the matters on which the Local level can levy tax by law?

The Local level may levy tax by law on matters falling within its domain without prejudice to national economic policies,  carriage of goods and  services, capital and labour market, and the neighbouring State or Local level.
What is the name of the fund that each Village Body and Municipality under the Local Level shall have?
Each Village Body  and Municipality under the Local Level shall have one Local Consolidate Fund.
What are the sources of revenue for the Local Consolidated Fund?

All revenues received by the Village Body or Municipality, any amounts of grants received from the Government of Nepal and the State Government, all loans raised by the Village Body and Municipality, and amounts received from other sources shall be deposited in the Local Consolidate Fund.
What is the purpose of the Local Consolidated Fund?
The Local Consolidated Fund is used for the purposes of the Village Body or Municipality as provided by law.
What entities are required to contribute to the Local Consolidated Fund?
Body and Municipality
What is the source of funds for the Local Consolidated Fund?
Amounts received from other sources
What is the provision for matters relating to expenditures from the Local Consolidated Fund under clause (1)?
Matters relating to expenditures from the Local Consolidated Fund under clause (1) shall be as provided for in the Local law.
What is the title of the object that contains the rules for the Local Consolidated Fund?
Local Consolidated Fund
What is the title of the text from which the questions and answers are derived?

Body and Municipality, and amounts received from other sources shall be credited to such a Fund. (2) Matters relating to expenditures from the Local Consolidated  Fund under clause (1) shall be as provided for in the Local law.
Who is responsible for laying an estimate of revenues and expenditures of every financial year?
The Village Executive and the Municipal Executive
Who has the authority to pass the estimate of revenues and expenditures?
The Village Assembly and the Municipal Assembly, respectively
What happens if a deficit budget is required?
The Village Executive or Municipal Executive must also purpose the sources to meet the deficit as provided for in the Federal law and the State law
Who is required to make a deficit budget?
The Village Executive or Municipal Executive
What is the process for laying an estimate of revenues and expenditures under clause (1)?
The Village Executive or Municipal Executive shall lay an estimate of revenues and expenditures under clause (1), subject to this Constitution
What is the first way in which the Federal Law may be made applicable?
The Federal Law may be made to be applicable to the whole of, or, if required, to any part of, the territory of Nepal.
What is the second way in which a State law may be made applicable?
A State law may be made to be applicable to the whole of, or as required, to any part of the territory of the State.
What happens if two or more States make a request to the Government of Nepal to make laws on any matter enumerated in Schedule -6?
The Federal Parliament may make necessary laws. Such laws shall be applicable only to the concerned States.
What is the third legislative interrelation between Federation and States?

If two or more States make a request to the Government of Nepal to make laws on any matter enumerated in Schedule -6, the Federal Parliament may make necessary laws. Such laws shall be applicable only to the concerned States.
What is the condition for a State law to be applicable to a part of the territory of the State?
A State law may be made to be applicable to the whole of, or as required, to any part of the territory of the State.
What are the principles that the relations between the Federation, States, and Local level should be based on?
The relations between the Federation, States, and Local level shall be based on the principles of cooperation, co-existence and coordination.
What power does the Government of Nepal have pursuant to this Constitution and Federal Law?

The Government of Nepal may give necessary directions to any State Council of Ministers on matters of national importance and on matters to be coordinated between the States, and it shall be the duty of the concerned State Council of Ministers to abide by such directions.
What is the duty of the concerned State Council of Ministers when they receive directions from the Government of Nepal?
It shall be the duty of the concerned State Council of Ministers to abide by such directions.
What action can be taken if any act that seriously undermines the sovereignty, territorial integrity, nationality or independence of Nepal is carried out in any State?

If any such type of act as may seriously undermine the   sovereignty, territorial integrity, nationality or independence of Nepal is carried out in any State, the President may, as required, warn such State Council of Ministers, suspend or dissolve the State Council of Ministers and the State.
What is the role of the President in the event of such an act in a State?
The President may, as required, warn such State Council of Ministers, suspend or dissolve the State Council of Ministers and the State.
What is the action to be taken on the State Council of Ministers and the State Assembly?
Ministers, suspend or dissolve the State Council of Ministers and the State Assembly for a period not exceeding six months.
What is the maximum duration for which the State Council of Ministers and the State Assembly can be suspended or dissolved?
for a period not exceeding six months.
What is the process for ratifying the suspension or dissolution of the State Council of Ministers and the State Assembly?
Any suspension or dissolution of any State Council of Ministers and State Assembly made pursuant to clause (3) must get ratified by a two -
What is the minimum number of votes required for ratifying the suspension or dissolution of the State Council of Ministers and the State Assembly?
a two -
What is the clause that authorizes the suspension or dissolution of the State Council of Ministers and the State Assembly?
clause (3)
What is the requirement for a thirds majority of the total number of the then members of the Federal Parliament within thirty five days?
The thirds majority of the total number of the then members of the Federal Parliament within thirty five days is required.
What happens if dissolution made pursuant to clause (3) is not ratified by the Federal Parliament?
If dissolution made pursuant to clause (3) is not ratified by the Federal Parliament, it shall ipso facto be invalid.
What is the period for holding an election to the State Assembly if dissolution made pursuant to clause (3) is ratified by the Federal Parliament?
If dissolution made pursuant to clause (3) is ratified by the Federal Parliament, election to the State Assembly shall be held within six months.

What applies to a State during the period of such suspension if the suspension made pursuant to clause (3) is ratified pursuant to clause (4) and until election to the State Assembly is held pursuant to clause (5)?
The Federal ruling shall apply to such State during the period of such suspension.
What matters can the Federal Parliament make laws with respect to during the continuance of the Federal rule?
The Federal Parliament may make laws with respect to any matter enumerated in the List contained in Schedule -6.
What continues to exist until repealed by other laws made by the concerned State Assembly?
Such laws shall continue to exist until repealed by other laws made by the concerned State Assembly.
Who may render necessary assistance to, and give necessary directives to, any Village Executive or Municipal Executive?
The Government of Nepal may, directly or through the State Government, render necessary assistance to, and give necessary directives to, any Village Executive or Municipal Executive.
What is the duty of the Village Executive or Municipal Executive with respect to directives given by the Government of Nepal?
It shall be the duty of the Village Executive or Municipal Executive to abide by such directives.
What is the duty of one State with respect to the execution of legal provisions or judicial and administrative decisions or orders of another State?
One State shall render assistance in the execution of legal provisions or judicial and administrative decisions or orders of another State.
What can a State do with respect to another State on matters of common concern and interest?
A State may exchange information and consult with another State on matters of common concern and interest.
What is a State required to do in accordance with its State law?
A State shall, in accordance with its State law, provide equal security, treatment and facility to residents of another State.
What is the Inter-State Council and what is its purpose?
The Inter-State Council is a council to settle political disputes arising between the Federation and a State and between States.
Who are the members of the Inter-State Council?

The Inter-State Council consists of the Prime Minister, Minister for Home Affairs of the Government of Nepal, Minister for Finance of the Government of Nepal, and Chief Ministers of the concerned States.
What is the Inter-State Council allowed to do when it meets?

The Inter-State Council may meet as required and may invite to its meeting a Minister of the Government of Nepal and a Minister of the concerned State who is responsible for the matter of dispute and a concerned expert.
What are the rules of procedures of the meeting of the Inter-State Council?
The rules of procedures of the meeting of the Inter-State Council.
What is the body that determines the rules for the Council?
The Council itself.
What is the role of the Federal Parliament in maintaining coordination between the Federation, State and Local level?
The Federal Parliament shall make necessary laws in order to maintain coordination between the Federation, State and Local level.
What is the role of the State Assembly in maintaining coordination between the State and Village Bodies or Municipalities?
The State Assembly may maintain coordination between the State and Village Bodies or Municipalities.

The State Assembly, in coordination with the concerned Village Body, Municipality and the District Coordination Committee.
What are the processes and procedures for the settlement of disputes under clause (2) provided for in the State law?
The processes and procedures for the settlement of disputes under clause (2) shall be as provided for in the State law.

To make any kind of obstruction to the carriage of goods or extension of services by a State or Local level to another State or Local level or to the carriage of goods or extension of services to any State or Local Level or to levy tax, fee or charge thereon or to make any kind of discrimination on the carriage or extension of such services or goods.
What is the jurisdiction of the Constitutional Bench of the Supreme Court not affected by?
Nothing contained in this Part.
