The jurisdiction of the Constitutional Bench of the Supreme Court under Article 137.
What is not allowed to be done according to Article 236 with regards to the levy of tax, fee or charge on the carriage of goods or extension of services?
To levy tax, fee or charge thereon.
What is the Commission for the Investigation of Abuse of Authority in Nepal?
There shall be a Commission for the Investigation of Abuse of Authority of Nepal, consisting of the Chief Commissioner and four other Commissioners.

The Chief Commissioner shall act as the Chairperson of the Commission for the Investigation of Abuse of Authority.

The Chief Commissioner shall act as the Chairperson of the Commission for the Investigation of Abuse of Authority.

The name of the person who acts as the Chairperson of the Commission for the Investigation of Abuse of Authority is the Chief Commissioner.

The President, on recommendation of the Constitutional Council.
What is the term of office of the Chief Commissioner and Commissioners?

If he or she attains the age of sixty-five years, the office of the Chief Commissioner or a Commissioner shall be vacant.

If he or she is removed from office by the President on recommendation of the Constitutional Council on grounds of his or her inability to hold office and discharge the functions due to physical or mental illness.

of his or her inability to hold office and discharge the functions due to physical or mental illness,

if he or she dies.

being a distinguished person, (d) having attained the age of forty five years, and (e) being of high moral character.

The Commission for the Investigation of Abuse of Authority may, in accordance with law, conduct investigations of any abuse of authority committed through corruption by any person holding public office.

The persons who can be removed from office by passing a motion of impeachment under Article 101 are not specified in the text.

In the case of the persons who can be removed by the Judicial Council, the Judicial Council may conduct, or cause to be conducted, investigations in accordance with the Federal law after they have been removed from office.

It may file, or cause to be filed, a case against that person and other person involved in that offense in the competent court in accordance with law.

Federal and State Government Offices including the Office of the President, Office of the Vice -President, Supreme Court, Federal Parliament, State Assembly, State Gov ernment, Local level, Constitutional Bod ies and Offices thereof, Courts, Office of the Attorney General, Nepal Army, Nepal Police and Armed Police Force, Nepal shall be audited by the Auditor -General.

Six years from the date of appointment.

A corporation, company, bank or board of which more than fifty percent or more of the shares or assets is owned or controlled by the Government of Nepal, except a university or Education Service Commission, or a commission, corporation, authority, body, academy, board, centre, council and other body corporate of similar nature established under the Federal law or formed by the Government of Nepal.

This provision shall not apply in cases where a state of emergency is declared because of extreme economic disarrays.

What are the functions of the National Women Commission?
The functions of the National Women Commission are to formulate policies and programs concerning the rights and interests of the women and submit them to the Government of Nepal for implementation.
What are the duties of the National Women Commission?

The duties of the National Women Commission are to monitor whether laws concerning the rights and interests of women and obligations under the international treaties to which Nepal is a party have been implemented, and make suggestions, accompanied by the measures for their effective compliance and implementation to the Government of Nepal.
What are the powers of the National Women Commission?

The powers of the National Women Commission are to assess, monitor and evaluate the existing policies and programs, and make recommendation to the Government of Nepal in order to have the women included in the mainstream of national development and ensure proportional participation in all organs of the State.

The National Women Commission formulates policies and programs concerning the rights and interests of the women and submits them to the Government of Nepal for implementation. What is prohibited in terms of imposing restrictions on political parties according to the text?

What can cause a state of emergency in Nepal?
A grave emergency can arise in Nepal due to war, external aggression, armed rebellion, extreme economic disarray, natural calamity, or epidemic.
Who can declare or order a state of emergency in Nepal?
The President can declare or order a state of emergency in Nepal.
Under what conditions can a State Government request a state of emergency in Nepal?
A State Government can request a state of emergency in Nepal if there arises a grave emergency in the State by a natural calamity or epidemic.
Can a state of emergency be declared or ordered for a specific part of Nepal?
Yes, a state of emergency can be declared or ordered for a specific part of Nepal.
What is the process for declaring or ordering a state of emergency in a State by a natural calamity or epidemic?

The concerned State Government may request the Government of Nepal to declare or order a state of emergency in respect of the whole of the State or of any specified part thereof, in accordance with this Article.
What is the action that every declaration or order made in accordance with clause (1) should be performed?
Every declaration or order made in accordance with clause (1) shall be laid before both Houses of the Federal Parliament for approval.
What is the time limit for approval of a declaration or order made in accordance with clause (1)?
The approval of a declaration or order made in accordance with clause (1) should be within one month after the date of issuance of such proclamation or order.
Where should the declaration or order made in accordance with clause (1) be laid for approval?
The declaration or order made in accordance with clause (1) should be laid before both Houses of the Federal Parliament.
What is the time period after which the proclamation or order is issued within which it should be laid before the Federal Parliament?

The declaration or order made in accordance with clause (1) should be laid before both Houses of the Federal Parliament for approval within one month after the date of issuance of such proclamation or order.
What is the action that should be taken if the declaration or order made in accordance with clause (1) is not laid before the Federal Parliament within the specified time period?
Not specified in the text.
What is the minimum number of members of both Houses of the Federal Parliament required to approve a declaration or order laid for approval in accordance with clause (3)?
at least two-thirds majority of the total number of the then members of both Houses of the Federal Parliament
What happens if a declaration or order laid for approval in accordance with clause (3) is not approved in accordance with clause (3)?
the declaration or order shall ipso facto be inoperative

not exceeding three months

A motion mentioned in clause (6) is passed by at least two - thirds majority of the total number of the then members of both Houses of the Federal Parliament.
What happens to the powers exercisable by the Federal Parliament in the event of dissolution of the House of Representatives?

In the event of dissolution of the House of Representatives, the powers exercisable by the Federal Parliament in accordance with clauses (3), (4), (6) and (7) shall be exercised by the National Assembly.
For how long does a declaration or order of a state of emergency continue in force if a motion mentioned in clause (6) is passed?
The declaration or order shall continue in force for the period mentioned in that motion.
What powers does the President have after the making of a declaration or order of a state of emergency in accordance with clause (1)?
The President may issue such orders as are necessary to meet the exigencies. Orders so issued shall apply as of law so long as the state of emergency is in operation.

The clause in (12) allows a victim to file a claim if an injury is caused to a person from any act done by any official in bad faith during the continuance of a declaration or order under this Article.

File a petition for compensation for such injury. If such petition is made, the court may order for compensation by, and punish, the perpetrator as provided for in the Federal law.
Who has the power to withdraw a declaration or order of a state of emergency made in accordance with this Article?
The President may, at any time, withdraw a declaration or order of a state of emergency made in accordance with this Article.
What are the conditions for amending or repealing any Article of this Constitution?

A Bill to amend or repeal any Article of this Constitution may be introduced in either House of the Federal Parliament. However, no amendment shall be made to this Constitution in a manner to be prejudicial to the sovereignty, territorial integrity, independence of Nepal and sovereignty vested in the people.
What is the rule about amending clause (1)?
Provided that clause (1) shall not be amended.
How long should a Bill introduced pursuant to clause (1) be publicly published for information to the general public?
A Bill introduced pursuant to clause (1) shall be publicly published for information to the general public within thirty days of its introduction in the concerned House.
What should happen if a Bill introduced pursuant to clause (1) is related with the alteration in the borders of any State or matters set forth in Schedule -6?

If a Bill introduced pursuant to clause (1) is related with the alteration in the borders of any State or matters set forth in Schedule -6, the Speaker or the Chairperson of the concerned House must send that Bill to the State Assembly for its consent, within thirty days after its introduction in the Federal Parliament.
What must the concerned State Assembly do when it receives a Bill presented for its consent pursuant to clause (4)?

The concerned State Assembly must, by a majority of the total number o f its the then members, accept or reject the Bill presented for its consent pursuant to clause (4 ) and give information thereof to the Federal Parliament within three months.
What happens if any State Assembly is not in existence?
If any State Assembly is not in existence, such Bill must be sent to the President of the Islamic Republic of Pakistan.
What is the time limit for a Bill to be either accepted or rejected in Parliament?
Parliament within three months.
What happens if a State Assembly is not in existence and a Bill is introduced?
Such Bill must be either accepted or rejected within three months after the date of holding of the first meeting following the formation of that State Assembly.
What is the consequence if information of the acceptance or rejection of such a Bill is not provided within the specified period?
Nothing shall
What is the condition for a State Assembly to be considered for the three-month period?

If any State Assembly is not in existence, such Bill must be either accepted or rejected within three months after the date of holding of the first meeting following the formation of that State Assembly.
What is the time limit for providing information of the acceptance or rejection of a Bill in the case of a State Assembly that is not in existence?
Such Bill must be either accepted or rejected within three months after the date of holding of the first meeting following the formation of that State Assembly.
What is the effect of the State Assembly giving a notice of rejection of a Bill to the concerned House of the Federal Parliament within the period under clause (5)?
The Bill shall be inoperative.
What is the minimum number of members required to pass a Bill which does not require the consent of the State Assembly or a Bill accepted by a majority of the State Assembly under clause (5)?
The Bill must be passed by at least two-thirds majority of the total number of the then members of both Houses of the Federal Parliament.
What happens to a Bill passed under clause (8)?
A Bill passed under clause (8) shall be presented to the President for assent.
What is the time limit for the President to give assent to a Bill presented under clause (5)?
The President shall give assent to a Bill presented under clause (5), within fifteen days from the date of its receipt.
What is the effect of the Constitution when the President gives assent to a Bill presented under clause (5)?
The Constitution shall get amended from the date of assent.
What is the requirement for a referendum to be held in Pakistan?

A referendum can be held in Pakistan if a decision is made by a two-thirds majority of the total number of the then members of the Federal Parliament that it is necessary to hold a referendum with respect to any matter of national importance.
What is the decision-making process for a referendum in Pakistan?
The decision on the matter can be taken by way of referendum in Pakistan.
What is the law that governs referendums and other relevant matters in Pakistan?
Matters relating to referendum and other relevant matters shall be as provided for in the Federal law in Pakistan.
What is the minimum number of votes required to initiate a referendum in Pakistan?
A two-thirds majority of the total number of the then members of the Federal Parliament is required to initiate a referendum in Pakistan.
What is the name of the law that provides details about referendums in Pakistan?
The name of the law that provides details about referendums in Pakistan is not specified in the text.
What power does the President have regarding pardons?
The President may, in accordance with law, grant pardons, suspend, commute or remit any sentence passed by any court, judicial or quasi-judicial body or administrative authority or body.
Who confers titles, honors and decorations on behalf of the State in Nepal?
The President shall confer titles, honors and decorations to be conferred on behalf of the State.
What is prohibited for a citizen of Nepal regarding foreign titles, honors or decorations?
No citizen of Nepal may, without the approval of the Government of Nepal, accept any title, honor or decoration from any foreign government.
What power does the Federation have to make?
The Federation shall have the power to make treaties or agreements.
What is required when making a treaty or agreement on a matter falling within the list of State power?
In making a treaty or agreement on a matter falling within the list of State power, the Government of Nepal must consult the concerned State.
What does the Government of Nepal do with regards to financial and industrial matters?
Government of Nepal, make contractual agreements on financial and industrial matters.
What is the process for ratification, accession, acceptance, or approval of treaties or agreements in Nepal?
The ratification of, accession to, acceptance of, or approval of, treaties or agreements to which Nepal or the Government of Nepal is to become a party shall be as provided for in the Federal law.
What is the title of the section that discusses ratification, accession, acceptance, or approval of treaties or agreements in the text?
279. Ratification of, accession to, acceptance of, or approval of, treaties or agreements:
What are the four actions that can be taken with regards to treaties or agreements in the text?
The four actions that can be taken with regards to treaties or agreements in the text are ratification, accession, acceptance, or approval.
What is the title of the law that governs the ratification, accession, acceptance, or approval of treaties or agreements in Nepal?
The title of the law that governs the ratification, accession, acceptance, or approval of treaties or agreements in Nepal is not provided in the text.
How is a bill made in the House of Representatives?
by a simple majority of the members present in a meeting of the House of Representatives.
What happens to a treaty or agreement after the commencement of the Constitution, unless it is ratified, acceded to, accepted or approved in accordance with Article?
such treaty or agreement shall not apply to the Government of Nepal or Nepal.
What is the condition for a treaty or agreement to apply to the Government of Nepal or Nepal after the commencement of the Constitution?
unless a treaty or agreement is ratified, acceded to, accepted or approved in accordance with this Article.
What is the condition for a treaty or agreement to not apply to the Government of Nepal or Nepal after the commencement of the Constitution?
unless a treaty or agreement is ratified, acceded to, accepted or approved in accordance with this Article.
What is the condition for a treaty or agreement to be concluded that may be detrimental to the territorial integrity of Nepal?
Notwithstanding anything contained in clauses (1) and (2), no treaty or agreement may be concluded in detrimental to the territorial integrity of Nepal.
What happens if the offices of both the President and the Vice-President fall vacant according to the Constitution?

The Speaker of the House of Representatives shall discharge the functions required to be performed by the President under this Constitution until election to the President or Vice-President is held and he or she assumes office.
What is the role of the Speaker of the House of Representatives when both the President and Vice-President's offices are vacant?

The Speaker of the House of Representatives shall discharge the functions required to be performed by the President under this Constitution until election to the President or Vice-President is held and he or she assumes office.
What is the duration for which the Speaker of the House of Representatives discharges the functions of the President when both the President and Vice-President's offices are vacant?
Until election to the President or Vice-President is held and he or she assumes office.
What event triggers the Speaker of the House of Representatives to discharge the functions of the President?
When both the offices of the President and the Vice-President fall vacant in accordance with this Constitution.
What is the condition for the Speaker of the House of Representatives to stop discharging the functions of the President?
When election to the President or Vice-President is held and he or she assumes office.
What is the Government of Nepal required to do every ten years?
The Government of Nepal shall make appraisal and review of the implementation of special rights of the women and Dalit community and impacts thereof, on the basis of human development index.
What is the principle on which the President may appoint Nepalese ambassadors and special emissaries?
The President may, on the basis of the principle of inclusion, appoint Nepalese ambassadors, and special emissaries for any specific purposes.
What is the role of the President regarding foreign ambassadors and diplomatic representatives?
The President shall receive letters of credentials from foreign ambassadors and diplomatic representatives.
What principle should be followed for appointments to office of Constitutional Organs and Bodies?
Appointments to office s of Constitutional Organs and B odies shall be made in accordance with the inclusive principle.
What is the title of the body mentioned in provision 284?
There shall be a Constitutional Council.
Who is the Chairperson of the Constitutional Council?
The Prime Minister
Who is a member of the Constitutional Council?
The Chief Justice
Who is another member of the Constitutional Council?
The Speaker of the House of Representatives
Who is another member of the Constitutional Council?
The Chairperson of the National Assembly
Who is another member of the Constitutional Council?
The Leader of Opposition Party in the House of Representatives
Who is another member of the Constitutional Council?
The Deputy Speaker of the House of Representatives
Who is included as a member while making a recommendation for appointment to the office of the Chief Justice?
The Minister for Law and Justice of the Government of Nepal
What must the Constitutional Council do before one month of the vacation of the office of the Chief Justice or a chief or official of a Constitutional Body?
Make a recommendation for appointment under this Constitution
What happens if the office of the Chief Justice or a chief or official of a Constitutional Body falls vacant because of death or resignation?
The Constitutional Council may so make recommendation for appointment that the office is fulfilled within one month after the date of vacancy

Not specified in the text

The rules of procedures on the appointment of the Chief Justice or chiefs or officials of Constitutional Bodies shall be as provided for in the Federal law.
Who acts as the secretary of the Constitutional Council?
The Chief Secretary of the Government of Nepal shall act as the secretary of the Constitutional Council.
What is the method of constituting the Federal civil service and other Federal government services?

The Government of Nepal may, in order to run the administration of the country, constitute the Federal civil service and such other Federal government services as may be required. The constitution, operation and conditions of service of such services shall be as provided for in the Federal Act.
How are positions in the Federal civil service and all Federal government services filled?
Positions in the Federal civil service as well as all Federal government services shall be filled through competitive examinations, on the basis of open and proportional inclusive principle.
Who is responsible for the State Council of Ministers, Villa ge Executives and other positions in the Federal government?
The State Council of Ministers, Villa ge Executives and other positions in the Federal government are filled by the State Council of Ministers.

open and proportional inclusive principle

State Council of Ministers, Villa ge Executives and Municipal Executives

What is the purpose of the law that can be constituted and operated by the mentioned entities?
The purpose of the law is to constitute and operate various government services as required for the operation of their administration.
What are the various government services that can be constituted and operated according to the text?
various government services

The Government of Nepal
What is the purpose of the Election Constituency Delimitation Commission?
To delimit the constituencies for elections

The Government of Nepal may constitute an Election Constituency Delimitation Commission

if he or she tenders resignation in writing,

if he or she is removed by the Government of Nepal, Council of Ministers,
What happens to the position of the Prime Minister of Nepal if he or she dies?
if he or she dies.
What are the two factors that the Election Constituency Delimitation Commission considers while determining election constituencies in Nepal?
population and geography as the basis of representation,
What are the additional factors that the Election Constituency Delimitation Commission considers while delimiting election constituencies in Nepal?
density of population, geographical specificity, administrative and transportation convenience, community and cultural aspects of the constituencies.
What is not allowed to be raised in any court?
No question may be raised in any court on any matter of the determination, or review, of election constituencies made by the Election Constituency Delimitation Commission.
What is the responsibility of the Election Constituency Delimitation Commission?
The Election Constituency Delimitation Commission shall submit a report on the works it has performed to the Government of Nepal.
What is the role of the Government of Nepal, Council of Ministers, with the report received from the Election Constituency Delimitation Commission?
The Government of Nepal, Council of Ministers, shall lay the report received pursuant to clause (8 ) before the Federal Parliament and send it to the Election Commission for implementation.
Who determines the rules of procedures for the Election Constituency Delimitation Commission?
The Election Constituency Delimitation Commission shall determine its rules of procedures itself.
What is the remuneration and facilities of the C chairperson?
The remuneration and facilities of the C chairperson are similar to those of the Chief Election Commissioner.
What are the remuneration and facilities of the members of the Election Constituency Delimitation Commission?
The remuneration and facilities of the members of the Election Constituency Delimitation Commission are similar to those of the Election Commissioners of the Election Commission, respectively.

The election constituencies delimited in accordance with clause (5) must be reviewed in every twenty years.

The Government of Nepal shall provide such employees as may be required for the Election Constituency Delimitation Commission.
What is the composition of the Language Commission according to the Constitution of Nepal?
The Language Commission shall consist of one Chairperson and a required number of members.
What is the term of office of the Chairperson and members of the Language Commission?
The term of office of the Chairperson and members of the Language Commission shall be six years from the date of their appointment.
What qualifications are required to be appointed as the Chairperson or a member of the Language Commission?

A person shall be qualified to be appointed as the Chairperson or a member of the Language Commission if he or she possesses the following qualification: (a) holding masters degree in related subject from a recognized university,
Can the Chairperson or members of the Language Commission be reappointed?
They may not be reappointed.
What is the definition of 'having high moral character'?
having high moral character.

having high moral character.

What are the circumstances under which the office of the Chairperson or a member of the Language Commission shall be vacant?

The office of the Chairperson or a member of the Language Commission shall be vacant in any of the following circumstances: (a) if he or she tenders resignation in writing, (b) if he or she is removed by the Government of Nepal, Council of Ministers, (c) if he completes the age of sixty five years, (d) if he or she dies.
What are the functions, duties and powers of the Language Commission?

The functions, duties and powers of the Language Commission shall be as follows: (a) to determine the criteria to be fulfilled for the recognition of the official language and make recommendations on languages to the Government of Nepal, (b) to make recommendations to the Government of Nepal, on the measures to be adopted for the protection, promotion and development of languages, (c) to measure the levels of development of mother tongues and make suggestions to the Government of Nepal, on the potentiality of their use in education.
What is the potential use of the Language Commission in education?
to study, research and monitor languages.
What tasks does the Language Commission have under sub-clause (a) of clause (6)?
to make suggestions to the Government of Nepal, on the potentiality of their use in education
What is the deadline for the Language Commission to complete its task under sub-clause (a) of clause (6)?
no later than five years after the date of its constitution.
What is the task of the Language Commission under sub-clause (d) of clause (6)?
to study, research and monitor languages.
What is the capital of Nepal?
The capital of Nepal shall be situated in Kathmandu.
What is the capital of a State under the Constitution of Nepal?
The capital of a State under this Constitution shall be as decided by a two -thirds majority of the number of the then members of the concerned State Assembly.
Where is the business of a state conducted if a decision has not been made in accordance with clause (2)?
The business of a state shall be conducted through the place as specified by the Government of Nepal until decision is made in accordance with clause (2).
What citizenship requirement is there for a person to be elected, nominated or appointed to certain offices in Nepal?

In order for a person to be elected, nominated or appointed to the office of President, Vice-President, Prime Minister, Chief Justice, Speaker of the House of Representatives, Chief of State, Chief Minister, Speaker of a State Assembly and chief of a security body, the person must have obtained the citizenship of Nepal by descent.
What citizenship requirement is there for a person who has obtained the citizenship of Nepal by descent for certain offices in Nepal?
A person who has obtained the citizenship of Nepal by descent, a
Who is qualified for the office of a constitutional body in Nepal, other than those mentioned in clause (1)?
A person who has obtained the naturalized citizenship of Nepal or a person who has obtained the citizenship of Nepal by birth.
What is the residency requirement for a person who has obtained the naturalized citizenship of Nepal to be qualified for the office of a constitutional body in Nepal?
The person must have resided in Nepal for at least ten years.

What is the residency requirement for a person who has obtained the citizenship of Nepal by birth or who has obtained the naturalized citizenship of Nepal in accordance with clause (6) of Article 11 to be qualified for the office of a constitutional body in Nepal?
The person must have resided in Nepal for at least five years.

What is the residency requirement for a person who has obtained the naturalized citizenship of Nepal in accordance with clause (6) of Article 11 to be qualified for the office of a constitutional body in Nepal?
The person must have resided in Nepal for at least five years.
What is the residency requirement for a person who has obtained the citizenship of Nepal by birth to be qualified for the office of a constitutional body in Nepal?
The person must have resided in Nepal for at least five years.
What does the Federal Parliament make necessary laws in relation to?
The Federal Parliament shall make necessary laws in relation to the rights of the trust and the farmers enjoying possessory rights over trust lands.
What is not to be prejudicial to the basic norms of the trusts?
The basic norms of the trusts.
What are other matters relating to trusts?
Other matters relating to trusts shall be as provided by the federal law.
What is the provision for the rights of the farmers enjoying possessory rights over trust lands?

The Federal Parliament shall make necessary laws in relation to the rights of the trust and the farmers enjoying possessory rights over trust lands in a manner not to be prejudicial to the basic norms of the trusts.
What is the provision for matters relating to trusts that are not specified?
Other matters relating to trusts shall be as provided by the federal law.
Who is not qualified for election, nomination or appointment to an office to be elected, nominated or appointed pursuant to the Constitution of Nepal?
A citizen of Nepal who has obtained a foreign permanent residence permit.

What prevents a person who has obtained a foreign permanent residence permit from being elected, nominated or appointed to an office to be elected, nominated or appointed pursuant to the Constitution of Nepal?

Notwithstanding anything contained elsewhere in this Constitution, a citizen of Nepal who has obtained a foreign permanent residence permit shall not be qualified for election, nomination or appointment to an office to be elected, nominated or appointed pursuant to this Constitution.

What action allows a person who has obtained a foreign permanent residence permit to be elected, nominated or appointed to an office to be elected, nominated or appointed pursuant to the Constitution of Nepal?
Renouncing such foreign permanent residence permit after the expiry of a period of at least three months.
What other matters relating to the citizens of Nepal who have obtained foreign permanent residence permits are as provided for in the Federal law?
Other matters relating to the citizens of Nepal who have obtained foreign permanent residence permits as mentioned in clause (1) shall be as provided for in the Federal law.
What parliamentary hearings are conducted as to appointments to the offices of the Chief Justice and Judges?
Parliamentary hearings shall be conducted as to appointments to the offices of the Chief Justice and Judges.
What can be conducted according to the text?

appointments to the offices of the Chief Justice and Judges of the Supreme Court, members of the Judicial Council, chiefs and members of Constitutional Bodies, who are appointed on the recommendation of the Constitutional Council under this Constitution, and to the offices of ambassadors, as provided for in the Federal law.
What is formed for the purposes of clause (1)?
a fifteen - member joint committee consisting of members of both Houses of the Federal Parliament, in accordance with the Federal law.
What is the role of the joint committee?
To appoint individuals to various offices as specified in clause (1).
What offices can the joint committee appoint individuals to, according to the text?

appointments to the offices of the Chief Justice and Judges of the Supreme Court, members of the Judicial Council, chiefs and members of Constitutional Bodies, who are appointed on the recommendation of the Constitutional Council under this Constitution, and to the offices of ambassadors, as provided for in the Federal law.
What law provides for the appointment of ambassadors?
The Federal law.
What is stated in clause (3) about the members of the joint committee?
No member of the joint committee under clause (2) shall practice law in the Supreme Court during that term of the Federal Parliament.
What is the title of the section that contains the rule about the members of the joint committee not practicing law in the Supreme Court?

There is no rule about the members of the joint committee in the section 293.

No member of the joint committee under clause (2) shall practice law in the Supreme Court during that term of the Federal Parliament.

What entities must the chiefs and officials of Constitutional Bodies be accountable and responsible to?
The Federal Parliament
What is the role of the committees of the House of Representatives regarding the functioning of Constitutional Bodies?

The committees of the House of Representatives may monitor and evaluate the functioning, including reports, of the Constitutional Bodies, other than the National Human Rights Commission, and give necessary direction or advice.
What should every Constitutional Body under this Constitution submit annually?
Every Constitutional Body under this Constitution shall submit an annual report of its functioning to the President.
To whom should the President cause the annual report to be laid?
The President shall cause that report to be laid through the Prime Minister before the Federal Parliament.
What should the annual report under clause (1) contain according to the Federal law?
The matters to be set out in the annual report under clause (1) shall be as provided for in the Federal law.
Is there any exception to the submission of the annual report under clause (1) to the President?
Notwithstanding anything contained in clause (1), a report may not be submitted to the President in certain cases.
What is the provision for the functioning of a Constitutional Body?
shall be as provided for in the Federal law.
What is the exception to the provision for the functioning of a Constitutional Body?
Notwithstanding anything contained in clause (1), a Constitutional Body may prepare a separate report in relation to the functioning of each State and submit it to the Chief of State.
What is the entity to whom a separate report prepared by a Constitutional Body is submitted?
the Chief of State.
What is the clause that the exception in the provision for the functioning of a Constitutional Body is notwithstanding?
clause (1)
What is the entity that a separate report is related to in the exception to the provision for the functioning of a Constitutional Body?
each State
What can the Government of Nepal do according to Part-33 Transitional Provisions?
The Government of Nepal may constitute a Federal Commission for making suggestions on matters relating to the boundaries of States.
How are the names of the States under clause (3) of Article 56 set?
The names of the States under clause (3) of Article 56 shall be set by a two thirds majority of the total number of members of the concerned State Assemblies.
What is the role of the commission constituted by the Government of Nepal according to Part-33 Transitional Provisions?

The commission constituted by the Government of Nepal shall determine the number and boundaries of Village Bodies, Municipalities and Special, Protected or Autonomous Regions to be formed under clauses (4) and (5) of Article 56.
What criteria should the commission follow while determining the number and boundaries of Village Bodies, Municipalities and Special, Protected or Autonomous Regions?

The commission must determine the number and boundaries of the Village Bodies, Municipalities and Special, Protected or Autonomous Regions in accordance with the criteria set by the Government of Nepal.
What is the purpose of the commission constituted by the Government of Nepal according to Part-33 Transitional Provisions?
The purpose of the commission constituted by the Government of Nepal is to make suggestions on matters relating to the boundaries of States.
What is the name of the entities established according to the criteria set by the Government of Nepal?
Autonomous Regions
What is the criteria set by the Government of Nepal for establishing entities?
Not specified in the text
What is the name of the commission to be constituted as per clause (3)?
Not specified in the text
What is the deadline for the constitution of the commission under clause (3)?
No later than six months of the date of commencement of this Constitution
What is the term of the commission under clause (3)?
One year
What is converted into the Legislature - Parliament after the commencement of the Constitution?
The Constituent Assembly existing at the time of commencement of this Constitution shall ipso facto be converted into the Legislature - Parliament after the commencement of this Constitution.
What is the term of the Legislature - Parliament?
The term of such Legislature - Parliament shall exist until 7 Magha 2074.
What happens if an election is held to the House of Representatives set forth in this Constitution prior to the expiration of that term?
The Legislature - Parliament shall continue to exist until the day before the day specified for the filing of nominations of candidates for that election.
What is the provision for the Legislature - Parliament if an election is held to the House of Representatives before the expiration of its term?

If an election is held to the House of Representatives set forth in this Constitution prior to the expiration of that term, the Legislature - Parliament shall continue to exist until the day before the day specified for the filing of nominations of candidates for that election.
What is the maximum duration of the Legislature - Parliament?
The Legislature - Parliament shall exist until 7 Magha 2074.
What happens to the Bills under consideration of the Legislature-Parliament at the time of commencement of this Constitution?
The Bills under consideration of the Legislature-Parliament at the time of commencement of this Constitution shall ipso facto be transferred to the Legislature-Parliament set forth in clause (1).
What is the role of the Legislature-Parliament set forth in clause (1) as per the Constitution?

The Legislature -Parliament set forth in clause (1) shall perform the business required to be performed by the Federal Parliament in accordance with this Constitution until election to the House of Representatives is held pursuant to this Constitution.
What is the legislative power of the State Assembly with respect of matters set forth in Schedule -6 upon the commencement of this Constitution?

The legislative power of the State Assembly with respect of matters set forth in Schedule -6 shall, upon the commencement of this Constitution, be vested in the Legislature -Parliament set forth in clause (1) until the State Assembly is formed.
What happens to any law made by the Legislature-Parliament set forth in clause (1) with respect to a State after one year of the date of formation of the State?
Any law so made shall be inoperative in relation to that State after one year of the date of formation of the State.
What is the relation to that State after one year of the date of formation of the State Assembly set forth in this Constitution?
Not specified in the text

What is the Legislature -Parliament Secretariat, its Secretary General, Secretary and employees existing at the time of commencement of this Constitution called in the Federal Parliament Secretariat set forth in this Constitution?

The Legislature -Parliament Secretariat, its Secretary General, Secretary and employees existing at the time of commencement of this Constitution shall, subject to the conditions of service in force at the time of their appointment, exist in the Federal Parliament Secretariat set forth in this Constitution.
What happens to the Legislature -Parliament if it is in recess at the time of commencement of this Constitution?

The President shall summon its session no later than seven days after the date of commencement of this Constitution. The President shall thereafter summon a session of the Legislature-Parliament from time to time.
What is the role of the President in summoning a session of the Legislature-Parliament?
The President shall summon a session of the Legislature-Parliament from time to time.

What is the minimum time period for the President to summon a session of the Legislature-Parliament after the date of commencement of this Constitution if the Legislature-Parliament is in recess at that time?
The President shall summon its session no later than seven days after the date of commencement of this Constitution.
Who will continue to hold their respective offices until other President and Vice-President are elected?
The President and the Vice -President existing at the time of commencement of this Constitution.
What is the condition for the President and Vice-President to continue holding their offices?

The President and the Vice -President existing at the time of commencement of this Constitution shall continue to hold their respective offices until other President and Vice-President are elected in accordance with this Article.
What happens to the existing President and Vice-President when this Constitution commences?

The President and the Vice -President existing at the time of commencement of this Constitution shall continue to hold their respective offices until other President and Vice-President are elected in accordance with this Article.
What is the process for electing a new President and Vice-President according to this Article?
Other President and Vice-President are elected in accordance with this Article.
What is the timeframe for the election of a new President and Vice-President according to this Article?
Other President and Vice-President are elected in accordance with this Article.
Who sets forth the Legislature-Parliament to elect the President and the Vice - President?
The Legislature-Parliament set forth in clause (1) of Article 296
When should the President and the Vice - President be elected according to clause (1) of Article 296?

The President and the Vice - President shall be elected no later than one month after the date of the commencement of this Constitution where the Legislature-Parliament is not in recess at the time of commencement of this Constitution and after the date on which the session is summoned in accordance with clause (6) of Article 296 where the Legislature-Parliament is in recess.
What happens if there is no political understanding under clause (2)?
In the event of failure to have an understanding under clause (2), the President and the Vice - President must be elected by a majority of all the then members of the Legislature-Parliament.
What happens if the office of the President or Vice - President falls vacant for any reason?

If the office of the President or Vice - President elected in accordance with clause (2) or (3) falls vacant for any reason, the President or Vice - President shall be elected by a majority of all the then members of the Legislature-Parliament.
What is the process for filling a vacancy in the President or Vice-President position according to the text?
The President or Vice-President shall be elected by the Legislature -Parliament in accordance with this Article until the Federal Parliament is formed.
Under what conditions does the President or Vice-President position fall vacant according to the text?
The position falls vacant in accordance with clause (2) or (3) for any reason.
What happens when the Federal Parliament is formed?
The process for filling the President or Vice-President position changes.
Who elects the President or Vice-President when the Federal Parliament is not formed?
The Legislature -Parliament elects the President or Vice-President.
What is the role of the President or Vice-President until the Federal Parliament is formed?
The President or Vice-President serves until the Federal Parliament is formed.
What is the term of office of the President or Vice -President elected in accordance with Article 61?

The term of office of the President or Vice -President elected in accordance with this Article shall continue to exist until another President or Vice-President elected by an electoral college set forth in Article 62 assumes office.
What are the circumstances under which the office of the President or Vice -President elected in accordance with Article 61 becomes vacant?

The office of the President or Vice -President elected in accordance with this Article shall become vacant in any of the following circumstances: (a) if the President tenders resignation in writing to the Vice -President and the Vice-President, before the President, (b) if a motion of impeachment against him or her is passed in accordance with clause (7), (c) if another President or Vice -President elected by an electoral college set forth in Article 62 assumes office.
What is the process for the President to tender resignation?
The President tenders resignation in writing to the Vice -President and the Vice-President.
What is the process for a motion of impeachment against the President?
A motion of impeachment against him or her is passed in accordance with clause (7).
What triggers the vacancy of the office of the President or Vice -President when another President or Vice -President elected by an electoral college set forth in Article 62 assumes office?

If another President or Vice -President elected by an electoral college set forth in Article 62 assumes office, the office of the President or Vice -President elected in accordance with this Article becomes vacant.
What happens if a President or Vice-President dies?
He or she does not die.
What is the minimum number of members of the Legislature-Parliament required to move a motion of impeachment against the President or Vice-President?
At least one fourth of the total number of the then members of the Legislature-Parliament set forth in clause (1) of Article 296.
What is the ground for impeachment against the President or Vice-President?
Serious violation of this Constitution and law.
What is the requirement for passing the motion of impeachment against the President or Vice-President?
The motion is passed by at least two thirds majority of the total number of the then members of the Legislature-Parliament.
What happens if the motion of impeachment against the President or Vice-President is passed?
He or she shall relive of his or her office.
What is the Council of Ministers existing at the time of commencement of this Constitution called?
The Council of Ministers existing at the time of commencement of this Constitution shall continue to exist until the Council of Ministers set forth in clause (2) is formed.
What is the time limit for the Prime Minister to be elected after the commencement of this Constitution?
The Prime Minister shall, on the basis of political understanding, be elected no later than seven days after the date of the commencement of this Constitution.
Under what conditions is a Council of Ministers formed after the date on which the session of the Legislature-Parliament summoned in accordance with clause (6) of Article 286 commences?
A Council of Ministers shall be formed under his or her chairpersonship where the Legislature-Parliament is in recess.
What happens in the event of failure to have an understanding under clause (2)?
In the event of failure to have an understanding under cl ause (2),
What is the role of the Prime Minister in forming the Council of Ministers?
The Prime Minister shall, on the basis of political understanding, be elected and a Council of Ministers shall be formed under his or her chairpersonship.
How is the Prime Minister elected?
The Prime Minister shall be elected by a majority of all the then members of the Legislature-Parliament.
What is the process for the composition and allocation of portfolios of the Council of Ministers?
The composition and allocation of portfolios of the Council of Ministers to be formed in accordance with this Article shall be made through mutual understanding.
What is the minimum number of members in the Council of Ministers?
The Council of Ministers to be formed in accordance with this Article shall consist of a Deputy Prime Minister and other Ministers, as required.
What is the title of the article that describes the election of the Prime Minister and the formation of the Council of Ministers?
This Article
What is the title of the body that is formed according to this article?
The Council of Ministers
Who is appointed as the Prime Minister according to Article 6?
The Prime Minister is appointed in accordance with this Article 6
What is the role of the Prime Minister in appointing Ministers?
The Prime Minister appoints Ministers in accordance with clause (5)
From where does the Prime Minister appoint Ministers according to clause (5)?
The Prime Minister appoints Ministers from amongst the members of the Legislature - Parliament
Who makes recommendations for the appointment of Ministers?
The concerned party makes recommendations for the appointment of Ministers
What is the process for appointing Ministers according to clause (5)?
The Prime Minister appoints Ministers in accordance with clause (5), on the recommendation of the concerned party
What is the collective responsibility of the Prime Minister and other Ministers appointed in accordance with this Article?
The Prime Minister and other Ministers appointed in accordance with this Article shall be collectively responsible to the Legislature -Parliament.
What is the individual responsibility of the Ministers for the work of their respective Ministries?
The Ministers shall be individually responsible to the Prime Minister and the Legislature- Parliament for the work of their respective Ministries.
What are the circumstances in which the office of the Prime Minister is vacant?

The office of the Prime Minister is vacant in any of the following circumstances: (a) if he or she tenders resignation in writing to the President, (b) if a vote of no -confidence is passed against him or her or a vote of confidence is not passed in accordance with clause (14), (c) if he or she ceases to be a member of the Legislature-Parliament, (d) if he or she dies.
What is the title of the Deputy Prime Minister, Minister, Minister of State and Assistance Minister appointed in accordance with this Article?
The office of the Deputy Prime Minister, Minister, Minister of State and Assistance Minister appointed in accordance with this Article shall
What happens if the State and Assistance Minister tenders resignation in writing to the Prime Minister?
if he or she tenders resignation in writing to the Prime Minister,
What happens if the Prime Minister is removed from office in accordance with clause (8)?
if the Prime Minister is removed from office in accordance with clause (8),
What happens if the State and Assistance Minister is removed from office by the Prime Minister on the recommendation or advice of the concerned party?
if he or she is removed from office by the Prime Minister on the recommendation or advice of the concerned party,
What happens if the State and Assistance Minister dies?
if he or she dies.
What happens when the office of the Prime Minister falls vacant under clause (8)?
The same Council of Ministers shall continue to act until another Council of Ministers is constituted.
Who acts as the Prime Minister if the Prime Minister appointed in accordance with this Article dies?
The Deputy Prime Minister or senior-most Minister shall act as the Prime Minister until another Prime Minister is appointed.
What can the Prime Minister appointed in accordance with this Article do to show/clarify that he or she has confidence from the Legislature-Parliament?

The Prime Minister appointed in accordance with this Article may, whenever he or she considers necessary or appropriate, table a resolution to that effect in the Legislature-Parliament for the vote of confidence.
What can happen if at least one-fourth of the total number of the then members of the Legislature -Parliament table a motion of no -confidence?
At least one-fourth of the total number of the then members of the Legislature -Parliament may table in writing a motion of no -confidence.
What can the Legislature - Parliament do according to the text?
The Legislature - Parliament may table in writing a motion of no -confidence against the Prime Minister appointed in accordance with this Article.
What is the condition for tabling a motion of no confidence against the Prime Minister?
A motion of no confidence shall not be tabled more than once in six months' period against the same Prime Minister appointed in accordance with this Article.
What is the decision-making process for a motion tabled under clauses (1, 2), and (13) or (15)?
A motion tabled under clauses (1, 2), and (13) or (15) shall be decided by a majority of the total number of the then members of the Legislature - Parliament.
What government is to exercise the powers of a State until the Council of Ministers of the State set forth in this Constitution is formed?
The Government of Nepal shall, after the commencement of this Constitution, exercise the powers of a State until the Council of Ministers of the State set forth in this Constitution is formed.
What is the provision mentioned in Article 299?
The Government of Nepal shall, after the commencement of this Constitution, exercise the powers of a State until the Council of Ministers of the State set forth in this Constitution is formed.
Who shall continue to hold their respective offices until another Speaker and Deputy Speaker is elected pursuant to this Constitution?
The Speaker and Deputy Speaker existing at the time of commencement of this Constitution
What happens to the Speaker and Deputy Speaker at the time of commencement of this Constitution?
They shall continue to hold their respective offices until another Speaker and Deputy Speaker is elected pursuant to this Constitution.
Who is the new Speaker and Deputy Speaker elected after the existing ones?
Not specified in the text.
When is the new Speaker and Deputy Speaker elected?
Not specified in the text.
What is the process for electing the new Speaker and Deputy Speaker?
Not specified in the text.
Who are the members of the Legislature - Parliament?
The members of the Legislature - Parliament are not specified in the text.
What is the role of the Speaker and Deputy Speaker in the Legislature - Parliament?
The role of the Speaker and Deputy Speaker in the Legislature - Parliament is not specified in the text.
How are the Speaker and Deputy Speaker elected?

The Speaker and Deputy Speaker are elected on the basis of political understanding by the members of the Legislature - Parliament. If there is no political understanding, a member who commands a majority of all the then members of the Legislature - Parliament shall be deemed to be elected as the Speaker or Deputy Speaker.
When is the Speaker and Deputy Speaker elected?

The Speaker and Deputy Speaker are elected no later than twenty days after the date of the commencement of this Constitution if the Legislature - Parliament is not in recess at the time of commencement of this Constitution, and after the date on which the session of the Legislature - Parliament is summoned in accordan ce with clause (6) of Article 296 if the Legislature-Parliament is in recess.
What happens if there is no political understanding to elect the Speaker and Deputy Speaker?

In the event of failure to have an understanding under clause (2), a member of the Legislature - Parliament who commands a majority of all the then members of the Legislature - Parliament shall be deemed to be elected as the Speaker or Deputy Speaker.
What is stated in clause (2) or (3) regarding the Speaker and Deputy Speaker in the Legislature-Parliament?
The Speaker and the Deputy Speaker shall be members representing different political parties in the Legislature-Parliament.
What is the function of the Speaker or Deputy Speaker in accordance with this Constitution?
The Speaker or Deputy Speaker shall discharge functions in the capacity of a neutral person without standing for or against any political party whatsoever.
What are the circumstances under which the office of the Speaker or Deputy Speaker shall become vacant?

The office of the Speaker or Deputy Speaker shall become vacant in any of the following circumstances: (a) if he or she resigns in writing, (b) if he or she ceases to be a member of the Legislature-Parliament, (c) if a resolution is passed by a majority of at least two-thirds of the total number of the members of the Legislature-Parliament to the effect that his or her conduct is not compatible with his or her office, (d) if he or she dies.
What happens if the Speaker or Deputy Speaker resigns in writing?
If the Speaker or Deputy Speaker resigns in writing, the office of the Speaker or Deputy Speaker shall become vacant.
What happens if the Speaker or Deputy Speaker ceases to be a member of the Legislature-Parliament?
If the Speaker or Deputy Speaker ceases to be a member of the Legislature-Parliament, the office of the Speaker or Deputy Speaker shall become vacant.
Who presides over a meeting at which deliberations are to be held on a resolution that the conduct of the Speaker of the Legislature-Parliament is not compatible with his or her office?
The Deputy Speaker or another member
Can the Speaker take part and vote in the deliberations on a resolution that his or her conduct is not compatible with the office?
Yes
What are the procedures on the election to the Speaker and Deputy Speaker?
They are as provided by the then prevailing rules of the Legislature - Parliament
What are the procedures on moving and passing a motion that the Speaker or Deputy Speaker has committed conduct not compatible with his or her office?
They are as provided by the then prevailing rules of the Legislature - Parliament
What is the title of the section that discusses the procedures for a resolution against the Speaker's conduct?
What provisions relate to the Judiciary according to the text?

The provisions relate to the Supreme Court, Constituent Assembly Court, Appellate Courts and District Courts existing at the time of commencement of this Constitution, the establishment of High Courts set forth in Article 139, and the appointment of the Chief Justice and Judges of the Supreme Court, Chief Judges and Judges of the Appellate Courts and Judges of the Districts Counts.
What existing Courts will continue to exist until the structure of Judiciary set forth in this Constitution is set up?
The Supreme Court, Constituent Assembly Court, Appellate Courts and District Courts existing at the time of commencement of this Constitution will continue to exist.
What cases can be settled by respective Courts according to the text?
The respective Courts can settle the cases already filed in such Courts prior to the commencement of this Constitution and of the cases to be filed after the commencement of this Constitution.
When will the High Courts set forth in Article 139 be established?
The High Courts set forth in Article 139 will be established no later than one year after the date of commencement of this Constitution.
Who are deemed to have been appointed under this Constitution?
The Chief Justice and Judges of the Supreme Court, Chief Judges and Judges of the Appellate Courts and Judges of the Districts Counts are deemed to have been appointed under this Constitution.
What is the timeframe for the dissolution of Appellate Courts after the commencement of this Constitution?
The Appellate Courts existing at the time of commencement of this Constitution shall be dissolved after the establishment of such Courts.
What happens to the cases sub judice in the Appellate Courts after the establishment of High Courts?

The cases sub judice in the Appellate Courts shall be transferred to such High Courts as specified by the Government of Nepal, in consultation with the Judicial Council, by notification in the Nepal Gazette.
What is the process for transferring cases from Appellate Courts to High Courts?

The cases sub judice in the Appellate Courts shall be transferred to such High Courts as specified by the Government of Nepal, in consultation with the Judicial Council, by notification in the Nepal Gazette.
What is the role of the Judicial Council in the transfer of cases from Appellate Courts to High Courts?
The Judicial Council is consulted by the Government of Nepal in the process of transferring cases from Appellate Courts to High Courts.
What is the method of notification for the transfer of cases from Appellate Courts to High Courts?
The transfer of cases from Appellate Courts to High Courts is done by notification in the Nepal Gazette.
What happens after the establishment of the High Courts according to clause (3) of the Constitution?

The Chief Justice shall, on recommendation of the Judicial Council, post the Chief Judges and Judges of the Appellate Courts who are holding office at the time of commencement of this Constitution to the offices of the Chief Judges and Judges of the High Courts.
What is the recommendation for the Chief Justice to post the Chief Judges and Judges of the Appellate Courts?
The recommendation for the Chief Justice to post the Chief Judges and Judges of the Appellate Courts is from the Judicial Council.
Who are the judges that may continue to hold office until the term specified at the time of their appointment?

The Additional Judges of the Appellate Courts who are holding office at the time of commencement of this Constitution may continue to hold office until the term specified at the time of their appointment.

What happens to the cases on criminal offences punishable by imprisonment for a term of more than one year and sub judice in any body other than a Court at the time of commencement of this Constitution?

After the commencement of this Constitution, the cases on criminal offences punishable by imprisonment for a term of more than one year and sub judice in any body other than a Court at the time of commencement of this Constitution shall be transferred to the concerned District Court.
What is the provision for the Additional Judges of the Appellate Courts in the Constitution?

The Additional Judges of the Appellate Courts who are holding office at the time of commencement of this Constitution may continue to hold office until the term specified at the time of their appointment.
What are the Constitutional Bodies which are existing at the time of commencement of this Constitution and provided in this Constitution?
The Constitutional Bodies which are existing at the time of commencement of this Constitution and provided in this Constitution shall be deemed to have been formed under this Constitution.
What happens to the matters under consideration of such Bodies?
Nothing shall be deemed to bar the settlement of the matters under consideration of such Bodies subject to this Constitution.
Who are the chiefs or officials of the Constitutional Bodies holding office at the time of commencement of this Constitution?
The chiefs or officials of the Constitutional Bodies holding office at the time of commencement of this Constitution shall be deemed to have been appointed in accordance with this Constitution.
What happens to the officials of the Commission for the Investigation of the Abuse of Authority and the Public Service Commission at the time of commencement of this Constitution?

The officials holding office in the Commission for the Investigation of the Abuse of Authority and the Public Service Commission, at the time of commencement of this Constitution shall continue to hold their respective offices subject to the conditions of services at the time of their appointments.
What is the subject of the text?
Investigation of the Abuse of Authority and the Public Service Commission
What is the status of the Investigation of the Abuse of Authority and the Public Service Commission at the time of commencement of this Constitution?
shall continue to hold their respective offices subject to the conditions of services at the time of their appointments.

not specified in this text
What happens to the Investigation of the Abuse of Authority and the Public Service Commission if the number specified in this Constitution is exceeded?
not specified in this text
What is the condition of service for the members of the Investigation of the Abuse of Authority and the Public Service Commission at the time of their appointments?
at the time of their appointments.
What does the Government of Nepal do according to clause 302.1?
The Government of Nepal shall make necessary provisions for the delivery of services at the State and Local levels.
What is allowed for the Government of Nepal to do under clause 302.1 according to the text?

The Government of Nepal may, in making provisions under clause (1), arrange for the delivery of services by making adjustment of the employees serving in the government services at the time of commencement of this Constitution with the Federal, State and Local levels in accordance with law.
What is the provision for the delivery of services at the State and Local levels according to the text?
The Government of Nepal shall make necessary provisions for the delivery of services at the State and Local levels.

What is the adjustment of employees serving in the government services at the time of commencement of this Constitution with the Federal, State and Local levels in accordance with law according to clause 302.2?

The Government of Nepal may, in making provisions under clause (1), arrange for the delivery of services by making adjustment of the employees serving in the government services at the time of commencement of this Constitution with the Federal, State and Local levels in accordance with law.
What is the purpose of clause 303 according to the text?
The text does not provide any information about the purpose of clause 303.
What will happen to the Local Bodies existing at the time of Commencement of this Constitution?

The Local Bodies existing at the time of Commencement of this Constitution shall continue to exist until the determination of the number and areas of the Local level in accordance with this Constitution.
How will the officials of the Local Bodies existing under clause (1) be elected?
Election to the officials of the Local Bodies existing under clause (1) shall be held in accordance with law.
How long will the officials of the Local Bodies elected in accordance with clause (2) hold office?
The officials of the Local Bodies elected in accordance with clause (2) shall continue to hold office until election to the Local level is held in accordance with this Constitution.
What laws will continue to be in force until such laws are repealed or amended?
The Nepal laws in force at the time of commencement of this Constitution shall continue to be in force until such laws are repealed or amended.
What will happen to any law which is inconsistent with this Constitution after one year of the Commencement of this Constitution?
Any law which is inconsistent with this Constitution shall ipso facto be invalid to the extent of such inconsistency, after one year of the Commencement of this Constitution.
What is the rule for an act to be invalid according to the text?
An act is invalid to the extent of such inconsistency, after one year of the date on which the first session of the Federal Parliament set forth in this Constitution is held.
What acts are deemed to have been done under this Constitution?
Acts relating to peace process under the Interim Constitution of Nepal, 2007 (2063) shall be deemed to have been done under this Constitution.
What is the time frame for an act to be invalid due to inconsistency?
An act is invalid after one year of the date on which the first session of the Federal Parliament set forth in this Constitution is held.
What is the significance of the first session of the Federal Parliament in relation to act invalidity?
The first session of the Federal Parliament set forth in this Constitution is significant because an act is invalid to the extent of such inconsistency after this date.
What is the status of acts related to the peace process under the Interim Constitution of Nepal, 2007 (2063) under the current Constitution?
Acts relating to peace process under the Interim Constitution of Nepal, 2007 (2063) shall be deemed to have been done under this Constitution.
What is the power of the President in connection with the implementation of the Constitution until the commencement of the first session of the Federal Parliament?

The President may, on the recommendation of the Government of Nepal, Council of Ministers, issue necessary orders to remove any difficulty that arises in connection with the implementation of this Constitution until the commencement of the first session of the Federal Parliament; and such orders must be submitted to the Legislature-Parliament or Federal Parliament, held immediately after the issue such orders, for approval.

Join C and G.
